title: Totally relaxing!
desc: No matter if you are staying a day or two or a week or even longer this hotel is just bloody good. Friendly, luxurious, tropical, modern, cozy and relaxing. But don't bother go to the beach. The pool is just fine. We, 4 adults and 2 children arrived half a day too early but we got a private place and a small VIP lounge. Very sweet. Thanks! (Beware of the monkeys climbing on the hotel facade, searching the balconies for food.)

title: Best family resort in Singapore
desc: Close to all the family entertainment district , with Universal Studios, Aquarium, monorail, shops and playgrounds. The area also provides free bus transport scheduled around the island, which is less cost to manage. Shopping centres are within this free bus transport, to provide a multitude of eating experiences. Well situated for some quiet time, the resort comes with many pools and it's own water park area, to occupy the kids....they will play all day on this. The weather is great. There is even a beach on your doorstep. Food restaurants are well catered, covering all tastes for breakfast. Dinners also are well catered, with different themed nights, reasonably priced. Rooms are clean and comfortable, and again reasonably priced. Best hotel for a family.

title: Nice hotel
desc: This hotel is one of the best hotel in sentosa island why ? It‚Äôs suitable for both families with children and couples or young travelers Has private big and clean beach Very big swimming pool Very nice breakfast Nice and friendly staff Big and nice view rooms And located near to all attractive places Highly recommended

title: One of the Best Tropical Beach Resorts
desc: Nothing beats the sun, sea and surf experience with family and friends, than what we had at The Rasa. There was hardly anything that was not available inside the resort - excellent rooms, superb food, great outdoors, and very well connected by shuttle buses and MRTs with the main Singapore city. Overall - A top rated resort in a top rated destination.

title: Kids
desc: Hello Another hotel another review. I would first like to thank you for having my family at your hotel. Thank you to all the staff that looked after and tailored my needs. This resort is truely number 1, for children. I was amazed at the detail and care that are directed at the children. I have never seen this before at any hotel. Highly recommend to anyone with children. Staff are highly trained and all confirm to one tune. Very well done. We had a few problems but the staff were quick to address and fix to the best of there capabilities. I found most staff to be quiet friendly and helpful. Thank you. The pool area does need more staff as it does get very busy, I wouldn‚Äôt recommend for couples that want quiet. The pool staff work very hard and deserve high

title: Great place for stayaction for Family
desc: We stayed over the long weekend and the stay was excellent. Room was spacious and the beds were just right. The best of all the hotel really accommodate to kids as they have kid sections - playrooms, art and crafts sessions, not to mention the pool areas as well. Even for breakfast, they have a section for kids! So thoughtful of the hotel. There is free shuttle to and fro the hotel to Vivo City everyday, at around 15 mins interval so do check out the schedule if you are planning to go out to Vivo.

title: Superb family experience
desc: I want to thank the crew at Shanghai-La for an amazing family holiday. Here‚Äôs why families should stay here and why you deserve 5 out of 5: the pool and slides and pool side facilities were AWESOME, the breakfast spread was FIRST-CLASS, the tropical location was BEAUTIFUL, the sheer attention to detail that is evidently paid by management to their guests‚Äô experience. My kids loved: the roaming peacocks, the room service cart/dining table, the slides, the pool balls to play with, the large comfortable sofa bed, the garden access, the complimentary mini bar items, the playground near the pool, the garden nursery with exotic SE Asia plant varieties and the ice machine near the room. My wife loved: the self service washer/dryer machine, the barnacles by the sea Sunday seafood

title: Perfect family stay.
desc: We have just returned from our visit where we stayed for four nights and wished we could have stayed longer. We travelled with 3 adults and four kids and arrived early in the evening. On arrival the staff could not have been more helpful and friendly with smooth check-in and helping us to our room. They also suggested where we could take the kids for a quick dinner before restaurants closed which we were extremely grateful for. The breakfast buffet was fantastic so definitely include that in your package and having a designated kids selection is brilliant and not something I had seen before. We also enjoyed one of the evening buffets (chilli mud crab night) and I would highly recommend trying this. It's excellent value and has a massive selection of food with drinks included.

title: hotel with beach
desc: located in Sentosa not far from the city ,the hotel has been refurbished the room are all modern and very clean the beds are comfortable the linen and towels clean and fresh ,good swimming pool for children .just outside the hotel you can go for hiking or for walk in nature park especially early morning.

title: AN EXCELLENT HOTEL 5***** HOTEL .
desc: This hotel is well worthy of being 5***** however make sure you book a sea view room to experience the magnificent outlook over the bay . well worth the extra expense and far superior than the SILOSA BEACH HOTEL" nearby.

title: Great location overlooking the South China Sea.
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights relaxation at the end of a 6-week holiday touring New Zealand. Located on Sentosa Island, but only around 15 minutes taxi ride to the centre of Singapore, this hotel is really good for a relaxing stay in Singapore. Check-in was fast and efficient and our room (a Panoramic Sea View Room), on the 9th floor had great views over the lush gardens to the ocean beyond. The room was very nicely furnished and well equipped, and the bathroom, with a bath and separate shower, had an unusual feature of plantation blinds, which could be opened into the bedroom to enjoy the views from the room. There was a furnished balcony, and the air conditioning was efficient, which is essential in Singapore. The view from the room was fantastic, and it was particularly

title: Just divine!!
desc: We stayed here as a stop over to Thailand. We wish we ended our trip here as they had so many beautiful preparations for Easter and it was wonderful in every way. Have to say aunty Lam‚Äôs waffles at breakfast were scrumptious along with her friendly smile and Vera made stunning little breakfast smoothies every morning and all staff remembered my little boys name! The self service washing machine and dryer were fantastic as with a little boy we needed to keep on top of our laundry. The buffet food was so cleverly and beautifully presented and the kids food station was great! Rooms were lovely and we were on the 3rd floor close to the restaurant and close enough to the pool! Was a very memorable stay and I do hope to be back!

title: Excellent stay
desc: This is a really nice hotel. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We got upgraded to a beautiful ocean view room for our wedding anniversary, and they left a celebratory cake in our room too! The room was large with plenty of storage. The bathroom was nice with plenty of amenities. It was spotlessly clean. The only thing I would say is that the bed was a bit hard and we both had broken sleep because of it. The hotel is well located on the beach front. It has a gorgeous pool which stays open into the evening. There's also a section just for adults which is a bit quieter and more relaxing. Sentosa is easy to walk around, but remember to make use of all the free transport. We ate dinner at the a la carte restaurant several times because it was so nice - and it gave

title: Best family getaway in Singapore!
desc: This was our third time with Shangri-La at Sentosa. We we love this property for the facilities, service and location. Kids love the club facilities, sports and recreation activities, pools and slides etc. The kids club team are really great in taking care of the little ones and arranging activities to keep them entertained. The breakfast and dinner buffets are another big attraction. Chef Pradeep and team delivers a food fiesta as per the daily themes which caters for everybody. We were pleasantly surprised to see some of the South Indian traditional breakfast items in the morning buffet. Rooms are always kept neat and tidy and the guys are doing an excellent job to make your stay comfortable. Overall we had a wonderful experience at Shangri-La and looking forward to our next

title: Wonderful place for family facation!
desc: We loved the spacious room (pool view) and the wide beds. Nice view from the balcony (even on 4th floor). The hotel area is compct and has well mainteined. Children loved the pools and activities in there. Breakfast is absolutely abundant. There is a shuttle bus that goes to Vivo centre (i think it was in every 20min) for free and tou can take subway or taxi etc to the city centre, so there is a easy access to the other places in Singapore without no time. Want to go backfor sure!

title: A value for money hotel in Sentosa island at Singapore
desc: We are a family of three and stayed at the Shangi-La for 6 nights during the easter break. The hotel is located at Sentosa island which is the home of many attractions at Singapore. Going to places in the island is pretty easy and free through a convenient bus transportation system. A free shuttle bus is available for the hotel guests from the lobby to the nearby ViVo City Mall where you can use the underground and go almost everywhere. The stuff is very friendly and kind doing their best to make your stay memorable. Our sea view king size bed deluxe room at the 9th floor looked a little bit old but it was nicely decorated and very clean without any smells and strange odors. Upon our arrival the mini bar was equipped with complimentary refreshments which we really appreciated.

title: Good resort, good staff
desc: Very friendly and helpful staff. Our rate included breakfast and the buffet was truly diverse and outstanding. Rooms clean and well appointed. Nice pool. This property is most definitely geared towards family and kids. I would rank the property as a solid four star hotel. While the staff were very attentive and warm, the hotel won‚Äôt match a very high end five star property. The cost was not the greatest value but Sentosa is a resort island and you should expect resort prices everywhere. Dinning options are limited. You can walk or shuttle to other areas and Vivocity for very extensive shopping and abundant dining.

title: Nice location, reasonable overall experience
desc: The hotel is well located within Sentosa island and in proximity of the beach with nice views. I would not have anything negative to say about it, but then again, it wasn't really great either. The check in could have been a bit faster, and the rooms somewhat better maintained. We stayed just for a night - overall a decent experience, but somewhat expensive for the value we received. The breakfast though, was outstanding - probably the best part of our stay.

title: A world away from the city
desc: We took a Family staycation getaway this weekend; once you cross the short bridge from the mainland and arrive on Sentosa you are a world away from the city. The resort is built into the jungle where the old Fort Siloso used to be. If you ignore the flotilla of boats and ferries in the background that throb back and forth, it is quiet and well geared for families with plenty to do in the property and close by on the island of Sentosa. As example, We experienced Earth Hour this weekend and the kids sustainable activities were happening all afternoon and up to 9pm. Multi lingual signage and staff as you‚Äôd expect from a High end hotel and a wide variety of food and beverage outlets; we were well taken care of. If you eat inside, the aircon is pretty aggressive, so despite 30C

title: YOU DON'T NEED ANYTHING BETTER THAN THIS RESOR
desc: No words can describe the Comfort & Happiness you will get at this Beach resort in Santosa. LOCATION - Private access to SILOSO BEACH, just 10-15 minutes from all major Attractions of Santosa. It is very very good Location. CONNECTED to all three beaches via free Beach Tram , This resort is a treat for travellers. HOTEL & PROPERTY SHANGRILLA offers amazing in-house Resturants , Bars, kids Leisure area , Kids water Pool area , Beach sports ( Kayake). Food is delicious and Staff serves you with great love & affection . We have tried some Indian Cusines , it's mind blowing. Breakfast is very lavish. Pool area is so huge , it has 4 sections ( Adult Pool , Kids Pool, water play area for kids , Water slides for kids ). Pool Bar is an amazing place to enjoy drinks.

title: Old but good
desc: Great place to stay with the children for a weekend. Rooms are a little bit on the small side so I would advise to get 2, staff is very friendly and helpful and food is amazingly good for a buffet restaurant

title: Relaxing Stopover
desc: Stayed here for two nights to break our journey from England to New Zealand. Lovely location, very relaxing, but the restaurants were a let-down. Very run of the mill, not what we expected from a Shangri-La. Recommend using the courtesy shuttle bus to the mainland and eating there.

title: tropical luxurious and perfect
desc: Amazing and ideal choice on the sentosa island. being close but far at the same time from the big city. tropical with magnificent ocean views, friendly personnel and very tasteful food. I believe a diamond of the Shangri La collection

title: Great location for a family holiday
desc: This is a great hotel for families and those with younger kids. Child friendly with a fair number of activities to keep the little ones busy. It's also very close to the city centre. The hotel has a shuttle bus service running every 20mins to the nearest MRT/Metro station and shopping centre, or one can simply call for a cab/grab/uber to the city attractions which are ~20mins away. The staff are friendly, helpful and very well trained. The rooms are clean and baby extras like cot/sterilizers/feeding chairs were all complimentary on request. It can be a little noisy and raucous, given the large number of kids, do try some of the other resorts/hotels on Sentosa island if one is looking for a quiet getaway or some tranquility... you have been warned! :)

title: Totally in Love!
desc: We love everything about this hotel. We both are Singaporean but have never stayed overnight at Sentosa Island because we believe that Sentosa is only for tourist. It was our 34th wedding anniversary and we decided to change our perception. So we checked in this property even though it was quite pricy and stayed 2 nights. It was a lovely experience and worth all the money spent. The beach right behind the swimming pool was one of the main reason I chose this hotel. We were swimming by 7am both mornings. We bought the sea view unit but were upgraded to the highest level panoramic view room and it was superb. The room was spacious and clean. Staff very courteous, friendly and helpful. It is conveniently located along the Siloso beach. Cafes and activities are just a walking

title: WoW experience
desc: Stayed 3 nights with family. Great location and decoration. My young son enjoyed every bit of it. Walking distance of all Sentosa attractions and convenient for roaming around Sentosa anytime of the day. Pool was amazing. My rooms, breakfast and service at the hotel were super satisfactory. Strongly recommended for leisure family travellers.

title: My favourite resort in Singapore! I can stay here all year long!
desc: Was very happy to see Chef Pradeep year after year putting together sumptuous buffet items for the diners. The rooms are nice n cosy as usual. Staff are smiley.. from front desk to the house keepers. Our little boy had fun at the indoor playground. I had fun kayaking out. Such a lovely stay. Luv it! Truly.

title: Excellent Service!
desc: The rooms were pretty standard with all features a good hotel should provide. Would have prefered if they used a particular brand for all amenities like shower gel and shampoo. But what won our experience were the hotel staff. I checked in to my room within minutes of arrival. Was give ushered to my room. And thereafter, the concierge team did a fantastic job hosting me and my family., suggesting dinner and lunch places at the nearby restaurants, buggy us to the restaurant and even recommended the must-try dishes. After dropping me at the nearby "Trapizza" restaurant they liaised with Trapizza staff to give them a call once we finish our meal so that they can pick us up on their buggy to the hotel. Excellent service.

title: Great Hotel
desc: Fantastic check in, arrived in the morning and they were able to check us in early. very appreciated. friendly staff, great breakfast buffet. special mention to the chef Amresh Ramadass who went over and beyond with his service at the wonderful seafood buffet dinner. This dinner was up there as one of the best we've had. what a wonderful asset he is to the hotel. Overall great hotel especially for families. We will definitely be coming back to Shangri-la the next time we are in Singapore.

title: It's Not the Newest Kid on the Block, but it's one of the Nicest
desc: While it's a little pricey, and it's not the newest hotel around, the place has been maintained quite well. Had a staycation here for 2D1N in one of the rooms facing the beach and the view was great. Amenities are good and breakfast has quite the variety! The kids pool is great for those with families and the peacocks are a nice addition to the property. The only thing was a few of the birds that tried to steal our food when we sat outdoors for breakfast, but I suppose that's just part of being out with nature! Service is good and the staff are helpful. Overall, it's a nice hotel to chill and relax.

title: Excellent staff
desc: Very nice resort, good facilities, The worst part is the breakfast restaurant. The staff is lazy, non-cooperative. Have to wait in Queue even when the place is half empty Alas, such bad service in an otherwise par excellent hotel

title: Soooo good. Great spot to base yourself for Sentosa attractions.
desc: Have stayed here a few times. Staff are really helpful even gave my son a present when they realised it was his birthday. Great for families. Easy to get to Universal Studios, water park etc. Monorail takes you to all attractions and a huge shopping centre. Pool and gardens are great.

title: Enjoyable stay
desc: We stayed in a deluxe sea view suite and the presidential suite, both for 3 nights. Both were nice, the deluxe suite had a great courtyard for kids and 2 seperate living spaces. The presidential suite was great, very roomy with a huge living/dining room, 2 bedrooms and views of the ocean. We were there during a long weekend so the resort was busy, with sun lounges being taken up and lots of people using the amenities. Pros -friendly staff -nice buffet breakfast -noodles restaurant very tasty -Italian restaurant on the beach was fantastic and great for kids -lovely views -fresh fruit delicious -resort is in a great location with lots of activities near by, including Universal Studios, cable cars, the aquarium and of course the beach - my 2 year old son loved the kids club

title: Nice pool and sea breeze, classic Shangri-La
desc: As always, the front desk service and cleanliness of the room was flawless, this hotel takes service seriously, it really impressed me. The pool area was a plus as well, its very well designed and a nice balance between tranquility and some liveliness from the kids play area. For those travelling with kids, there is no way they won‚Äôt love this hotel, it definitely caters to families. The only reason this is not a 5 star rating is the property does seem a bit old and the breakfast food, while it has everything you could ever want, has a commercial food feel. If you are envisioning a nice swim at the beach be forwarned that Sentosa does not have the cleanest water, the hotel does an impressive job of upkeep at the beach area but the inevitable trash in the water is simply a

title: Vacation in paradise
desc: We visited Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa (for the 3rd time) in June 2018 and were overwhelmed by the friendliness and attention of the staff. So many of them were not only willing to just do their job, they also went that extra mile to make our stay a very memorable one. There was the resident manager Ms. Mei P. Pun, very, very attentive and caring for the guests and for her staff, too. Then there was "our" perfect concierge, Prakash C. Raman, who "saved our lives" by getting our luggage back, which was lost on our flight to Singapore, took care for a birthday serenade and many more birthday and anniversary surprises, suggested two perfect locations for our celebrations (see our reviews of CeLaVi and Stellars at 1-Altitude) and also suggested the perfect places to shop; Wera and the

title: Simply The bestüëç
desc: You have no idea how Happy we became. üëç We arrived from Phuket and The last 24 hours we both was food-poisen. So we haven‚Äôt eat or slept - we was so tired when we came! The upgrade us to an amazing suite with A Huge balcony - The staff was so great üòÄ A Big pool-area, several restaurants and also A Beach. Are you going to Sentosa - stay here!

title: Rasa Sentosa
desc: We have just returned from a one week stay at Rasa Sentosa and my feelings are somewhat mixed. The rooms are quite dated and in need of a refurb, we had two interconnecting ocean view rooms and looking down from the balcony the pavers below are also in need of a good scrub. I'd be disappointed if we had paid for the large balcony villas as they had dirty pavers and fake grass which was lifting in some places.... The pool was sparkling clean and huge however pool side service could be hit and miss. Poolside entertainment was a hit with the many kids staying at the resort and it was fun to watch the staff interact with the kids, they seemed to enjoy their job. I noted there was some sort of conference at the resort one evening and they set up a beach side BBQ for them near the

title: Great for family with young kiddos
desc: We went during the local holidays and the resort was full of kids. The crowd is not too bad as it adds to the festive resort feel. We spent a lot of time at the pool and it did not feel too crowded. I must say their life guards are very pro active in calling out anyone who could be doing something dangerous or not attentive to young kids. There‚Äôs always something going on around the hotel be it pool activities or at the kids club. Service was really good all round except in F&B where it felt like they were understaffed. Buffet breakfast had a wide spread and got to love the kids corner where items were placed at the height for kids to help themselves. There was also a baby corner available. Room was clean and comfortable. My only gripe was that brown water was leaking

title: Great place for family short getaway
desc: This hotel is never short of visitors. It was a weekend stay and we signed up one of the family package, which includes breakfast and dinner buffet. The kids had fun in both toots and mini toots club as well as a whole afternoon in the pool area, My Kids were complaining not having enough time at the resort when we have to leave. One thing to bring up is the exceptional service provided by one of their housekeeper. Kok Keong knowing that our family has small kids, took initiative to load additional towels and bottled water in our room. He has gone out of his scope to ensure that all our needs were taken care of. A very humble young man when thanked would replied that he was merely doing his job.

title: Great for families
desc: This hotel provides great service, has large well equipped rooms with balconies looking out on the bay, an excellent pool, well kept grounds and access to a nice area of beach, with plenty of shade. The only downside for us were the restaurants that are limited and acceptable but not of great quality. There are plenty of activities for kids and the place is very family orientated, in my opinion, but there is an adults only section of the pool and if you want to escape the crowds at breakfast, head to the Rasa Boardroom on the 4th floor. At reception, they will tell you that it has a limited selection compared to the main restaurant, but it is perfectly adequate and you will probably have the place almost to yourself.

title: Excellent customer service fr front desk, kids area, pool lifeguards to restaurants etc.
desc: Overall I am impressed with hotel overall from customer service to facilities. And will like to till stay again. Got a room facing the sea view. Excellent environment for family (with kids), most important love the proactive attitude, attentiveness service of staffs there. Simply have to plan a longer stay there!!!

title: Good hotel
desc: A short stay at the Shangri-la which was very good. Lots of little extras which helped make the stay even better. Check in took a while as it was very busy but we got upgraded free of charge to a sea view room. We were on family fun package which was very good value for money. Highly recommend. It included b&b, dinner, access to the kids club and 1hour watersports. The hotel is really large and was very very busy during our stay this did put us off a little and there were lots of children around the pool. However the staff did seem to cope with this very well. We really enjoyed the food during our stay. Loads of choice but again the restaurant was full and at times it‚Äôs did seem quite chaotic. The extras we liked about the stay were the children‚Äôs entertainers offering

title: Staycation at rasa sentosa
desc: This is not my first time staying at Rasa Sentosa but the experience just get better each time. For this stay we booked a 3 night stay under the family fun package for two adults and 2 kids which comes with free buffet breakfast and dinner for two adults and two kids under 12. Check in was a breeze with the Golden circle membership app. The standard check-in time is 3pm but we managed to get our room an hour earlier which is always one of the things I look for. To make it even better we were upgraded to a paranoma suite that cost twice the room that we booked. What a great start to our stay ! The room was amazing with paranoma view of the sea and pool. We were also given a welcome basket of fruits and a bottle of red wine to go along with the views. The thoughtful

title: Good food
desc: Second time back in 2 years for a 1 week holiday, we book the suite because we have 2 kids 9 and 12 and its more comfortable, the room was clean and comfortable with heaps of good tv channels sport on fox too. The cupboard door would not close properly and I had to disconnect the light during the night as it is supposed to turn off when you close the cupboard. The ceiling fan would be good if you could control the speed of it. One of the pool fun team members called my daughter chubby when she was doing the mermaid game, my wife did not tell me until later because she knew I would have said something to him, I felt this was a bit ordinary. The food is awesome love the buffet never had a bad meal yet. Safe to eat everything and drink the water, the staff are mostly great one girl

title: Just perfect!
desc: We are a 3 family group from Wales, England and Australia having a wonderful bonding experience ages 70 down to just 1 year old. Staff are delightful, nothing is too much trouble and everyone is always smiling- well done! The activities on offer are inviting for all the family, the food is just amazing - 5 star. The hotel is big but never feels crowded and is peaceful, Peacocks, lizards and monkeys wander about. Location just perfect. So pleased we still have 8 more days here. Recommend it to everybody for a great family holiday. The Crawford Clan.

title: Good family resort
desc: We had a one night stay here. We arrived around noon but we were told our room would not be ready until the afternoon, but it still took a little while to get ready after we returned from lunch. We were given a garden room on the ground floor. We had a small terrace area outside the room, which gave us good access to the pool area. Our room was a decent size, large enough to fit a sofa bed for the children. There was sufficient storage space; and the usual kettle area and TV. The bathroom was large with separate shower and bath tub, as well as bidet. There are plenty of toiletries, although we had to request extra bath towel for the whole family. There were ants in our room, though. Staff came by quickly enough to spray the affected areas. Luckily the children were not

title: Island Getaway
desc: We had a sea facing room on the upper floor with a balcony. Bed is firm and comfy. Toilet have both a standalone shower and a bath tub which opens to the room allowing you to watch the tv from soaking in the tub. Ice machine located outside the corridor for self serve ice and cold water. Mini bar was complimentary for stay. Breakfast spread was excellent with a good combination of Indian, Asian, Continental and the likes. Do go early for breakfast especially if it is peak travel season as the queue can be quite long. Electrical outlet in room accepts global attachments. Singapore runs on 220/240V and uses the British BS1363 three-pronged square pin type socket

title: Awesomest resort
desc: We a family of 3 kids (15,12 and 4) visited this resort for 6 days this july .and were amazed with the wonderful happy geeeting staff members of shagrila.our special mention is their entire fun team specially 3 heroes ROY, FAITH and LEO.Seriously we have been to so many resorts but the life these 3 bring to a resort,we hve never witnessed it before.hats of to them all.our kids were in tears when coming back.the water polo tons of other games at pool side as well as karoake songs they sing is a speciality each day which our kids found v difficult to let go of. The entire staff in hotel is all smiles all the time and v v helpful for everyone irrespective of any nationality. Their shuttle service to vivo mall is too good and on time .the location of the resort is just the best on

title: Absolutely fantastic
desc: Hi all. I‚Äôm writing this review as we are still staying at the hotel. Believe me when I say it‚Äôs fantastic. Since we have arrived it‚Äôs been 5 Star. The room, the food, the amenities, the service, the staff......excellent. Few more days left till we go home so we will enjoy them whilst they last. Use the kids club and take advantage of some quiet time and a Siloso Colada. Cheers.

title: Beautiful and Relaxing
desc: Very easy for checkin and checkout.Beautiful resort and family friendly. Front and concierge are polite and friendly. Delicious foods I really appreciated the amenities,balloon decors in our room and cake for my son..Thank you for the wonderful stay!

title: Friendly and helpful staff
desc: I was here with my family from 1 Aug to 3 Aug. Beautiful location. Staff here are always offering for help which i truly appreciate. My kids love the pool setting especially the three slides to choose from. Room is clean and quiet. Easy to move around sentosa with accessible shuttle bus and free shuttle to vivo city. Restaurants here are not halal certified but they serve halal food. You just need to reach out to their staff. When i checked out there was a long line so i just did a mobile check out which took me less then a minute and i am done! Excellent!

title: Nice base for sentosa
desc: After staying in shangri la near orchard road this was a little disappointing for us . Breakfast buffet extremely expensive and not good . Rooms are nice and our evening meal was nice . Staff lovely and very helpful . Rooms bit noisy

title: Summer holidays
desc: Everyone says August in Singapore is rainy and humaid , personally don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs as hot as other countries , weather is good for pool and activities. It‚Äôs rains like 20 minutes a day max Hotel is great for families, easy check in rooms were ready as requested , amenities and balloons for kids were there . Small touches such as balloons for kids before breakfast or some juice while waiting for the table . The restaurant manager was very helpful hardworking lady even during my stay I complained about noise she took the matter herself Hotel maybe needs to work on more kids amenties during the stay example small chocolate or candy on the pillow for the children. Working in same field for years , a very impressed moved I like was we were at the pool bar and the sister his

title: Great fun!
desc: We visited to spend time with friends, we live in the UK, they live in Australia. It was great. The adults got to relax and catch up while the kids enjoyed the fun team activities and the pool. While we spent a lot of time at the hotel, we also found the location good for getting out and about. We loved the pizza restaurant on the beach, and walking a bit further to the bars and restaurants of Sentosa in the evening. It was great. The only reason it didn‚Äôt get 5 stars was that the food could have been better.

title: First visit and it wont be our last!
desc: We stayed at Rasa Sentosa for 5 nights in November 2018. The property was amazing and the service was outstanding. We had booked a panoramic sea view room which was spacious and well appointed. Bed was really comfy, lots of bottled water available every day. I even got a cake for my birthday - much appreciated. We arrived quite late on the Monday, but check in was quick and efficient. Because we hadn't had time to have tea, we order room service, a club sandwich which we shared because it was huge! The breakfast buffet was amazing, plenty of choices both Western, Indian & Asian, they even had hot dogs available! Because it was the start of school holidays, there were a lot of families around, but in general because we were out and about each day noise wasn't an issue,

title: Had everything we needed, and more!
desc: Really enjoyed staying here, the staff are wonderful, helpful, professional and thoughtful. Kids loved the pool area especially Easy bus into attractions we wanted to visit, and loved the many and delicious food and drink options.

title: Fabulous resort
desc: This was our second stay at this fabulous hotel, it is lovely with wonderful staff and great service. We had a lovely large room overlooking the beautiful pool, gardens and the sea. Fabulous facilities, lovely restaurants serving good food and excellent breakfasts. A really nice Spa with a great choice of treatments, I enjoyed their special offer of reflexology and back massage, spa use is complimentary with a treatment. It was 10 years between our two trips, both times we chose to stay at the Rasa Sentosa for 3 nights on our way back to the UK from Perth, Australia. The main difference between 2008 & 2018 was the view of the South China Sea, the port in Singapore has grown rapidly and the amount of ugly sea vessels seen from the hotel and on the balconies really spoils the

title: First family break since the youngest boy came along
desc: I stayed from 18 to 20 Dec 2018 with hubby and two boys (11 & 3 yrs old). My older boy had been to Rasa Sentosa thrice, whereas it was my younger boy‚Äôs first visit. It was also my younger boy‚Äôs first family vacation. Although it was only a staycation, we all love Rasa Sentosa very much, especially the Family Package. We were very glad that we could get the pool view room even during this peak period. The pool view room has a bathtub with showering room compared to the seaview room which has only shower facility, my boys love the bathtub. It was very crowded in the swimming pool, as well as the buffet dining area. It was also our first time doing a holiday so near to Christmas week, service was rather different since our last visit few years back. Previously, there were

title: 5 star Accomodation & 5 star service
desc: Our rxperience at the resort could not be faulted. Although pricey at Xmas this resort is perfect for those family looking for 5 star accommodation and is kid friendly as well. Complimentary water bottles. Free takeaway coffee in the morning and a well equipped bathroom with shower mat and stool for young kids to brush teeth was all amazing and thought out.

title: Perfect beach hotel
desc: stayed in Shangri-La‚Äôs Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa, Singapore, with my wife and two kids for 5 nights during Christmas week stayed in a deluxe garden room which had easy access to the pool and beach, the room was perfect for 4 of us with extra bed, the location is just amazing with easy connection to all the attraction of the Sentosa, even though the hotel is old it is maintained perfectly, we loved every minute of our stay at this hotel. will be back soon.

title: Good holiday hotel
desc: Our room was large spotlessly clean, nicely furnished with a lovely balcony overlooking the large pool area. Breakfast was very extensive with western, Chinese and Indian food available. The hotel was like any holiday hotel you find anywhere in the world. It is great for families.

title: Best waffles
desc: I've never liked waffles because even after going to the best places, I simply couldn't find amazing waffles. Well, until I went to this hotel and had their waffles in the morning. Now, I can't stop thinking about them. Another month of this and I'll fly to Singapore just to try those waffles again.

title: Lovely family break, room for improvement.
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights in December enroute to Australia. Having stayed here for Christmas many years ago, this was our first choice for our Singapore stopover. We booked the Family Fun Package, children 12 (classed as adult) and 9, sharing a sofa bed but the room was a good size considering all the luggage we had. We had requested a high floor but were put on Floor 3 (same level as restaurants) which proved very handy and we were never in the room long enough to look at the view ! We enjoyed the leisure facilities, pool staff very proactive on blowing up inflatables. Special mention to Faith who was wonderful with all the children. Good food choices at breakfast and dinner buffets (included in the package). Drinks and pool lunches pricey as can be expected, just remember

title: Great for families with little kids - NOT for couples!
desc: This is the first time I have written a review while still in the hotel. My partner and I have just had a wonderful but very busy holiday travelling round New Zealand for 4 weeks and we asked Trailfinders to recommend a hotel in Singapore where we could completely relax, chill and have a romantic couple of days rest before going home to the UK. They recommended this hotel. BIG EXPENSIVE MISTAKE! 98% of the other people staying here have children mainly aged under 9 years old. They are swarming round the hotel corridors, the beach and the swimming pool screaming and shrieking (quite often crying too) and but mostly having a great time. I am very happy they are enjoying themselves I just wish I had chosen to go somewhere else! I feel like I am in a giant cr√®che! The hotel is

title: Large, bustling family resort
desc: Spent just the one night here before catching a flight home. It is an impressive place with large grounds, a beach, and a good pool. There are lots of choices of places to eat. The bedroom was comfortable and well equipped, if a little dated. The resort looks a little ragged around the edges if you look closely enough. It is very much a family resort. So I wouldn‚Äôt recommend going here for a relaxing time if you don‚Äôt have kids. If you do have children, the resort seems to cater very well for them. The breakfast buffet, for example, is big with a good choice but it is very busy and the quality of food is average. The staff were friendly and helpful. There are good connections to the rest of Sentosa and lots of activities nearby.

title: Always the best!
desc: I cannot speak highly enough of this beautiful resort. The rooms are spotless and well appointed, the beds so comfortable and the access to all the attractions in Sentosa is faultless. The free shuttle to Vivo City is so handy and reliably on time. Morning walks along the beach are just an added bonus. We were lucky enough to spy some cheeky monkeys raiding the balconies of goodies one morning. There are signs around the hotel not to feed the monkeys but we had stayed there twice'before and hadnt seen any- so the signs are true.

title: Great resort away from hustle and bustle
desc: A bit far away by Singapore standards but still within 15-30 mins from most places you may want to go. Now with ‚ÄúGrab‚Äù in Singapore, it‚Äôs easy to get transport to and from Sentosa. Great to be able to retreat from the busy city of Singapore and relax by the beach or pool at the resort. Rooms and service are good ( but pricey!!!) Our 4th visit and kids still love it.

title: Absolutely amazing !!
desc: One of the best hotels that I have visited in my travel journey so far. The place, the hotel and the ambience is just out of the world. The structure along with the amenities and surroundings is almost surreal.

title: Great Hotel And Staff
desc: We have visited this hotel several times and this time it was the best level of standard of service, professionalism and courteous rapport we have experienced. What another great stay. The hotel has improved on many things. The food is Casserole is world class. Absolutely superb and the staff there are so kind and helpful especially when knowing my husband is still recovering from heart surgery. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Wether we ate a la carte or had the local buffet the Casserole staff found us a quiet table and remembered our favourite rose wine and were extremely helpful. Breakfast is now available in two areas to take the load off the main restaurant. However breakfast in Silver Shell is still one of the best breakfasts in any hotel in the world! (Shangri

title: Dream Wedding Come True
desc: Chose Rasa as our wedding venue and both my Husband and I could not be more pleased. Firstly, the location was itself was a dream. We held our solemnisation at Rasa‚Äôs iconic venue, the Rocks, which was a picturesque lawn facing the ocean, cliffs and majestic trees as our backdrop. Our dinner banquet was held on the beach with a canopy of fairylights the lit the night. Secondly, we had the international BBQ buffet and to our pleasant surprise we had so much compliments from our guest that it was the best buffet they ever had - that‚Äôs high praise! All thanks to Chef Jonathan and Chef Pradeep. Of course the night was only made smooth thanks to Roger the Banquet Manager who was so accommodating throughout the night, and Selvam and Fahmy the AV crew. The program was seamless

title: Unpleasant experience at checkin
desc: A delay in checking-in is not what one would expect from 5-star hotel. Especially when half hour led to another half hour past 3 pm. While the service was courteous, much was left to be desired when the same excuse was given - the cleaners need to inspect the room. We finally settled into our room at 3.40 pm. Otherwise, the hotel stay was pleasant as always. Shangri-la does not disappoint in its amenities and facilities, but this too-busy-to-get-room-ready is not acceptable esp when checkout time is strictly adhered to.

title: The whole family loved it
desc: Beautiful well run resort. The pool is great. Kids club was good. Food good. Sentosa itself is easy to get around (free buses and walkable). Accommodation clean and comfortable. Couldn't ask for more.

title: Fantastic Staff and a Lovely Resort
desc: This hotel is a perfect ingredient for a staycation weekend. Fantastic staff from the Kids Club, Lifeguard Team and Beach Bar - Faith, Jocel, Benny, Mangel and many more staff were really nice. Great fun games around the resort and a great location with a lovely view. Room is great - comfy beds and a pleasent bathroom. Hope to stay again soon.

title: Sentosa Style
desc: A lovely 5 Star resort located by the beach on Sentosa Island. The rooms are a little dated but are neat, clean and comfortable. Make sure you include breakfast in your package as the choices on offer are dazzling. Delicious! The staff are also very friendly, helpful and courteous. There's also a terrific swimming pool with an adults only section. Getting around?? Take the free shuttle bus to Vivo City or hop on the Sky Car to the attractions around the centre of the island. If you want things a little laid back then catch the free tram located around the corner which will take you to the main monorail stop. Sentosa Island is a must do and this resort is a great stepping stone to everything you need to see.

title: Wish I could leave
desc: I‚Äôve been here for a few hours and want to leave. It started with the tiny room, and then the brown stained toilet almost made me sick. The staff did attempt to help us move rooms, but they could not find a room without a rusted out, brown stained toilet. Absolutely disgusting. The pool is full of screaming kids not monitored by parents. You cannot go down the slide without a flotation device, so my son cannot partake in the slide. The kids playground reeks of raw sewerage. The beach is an absolute disgrace, me and my son literally ran back to the pool. It was dirty and littered with cigarette butts and bandaids. The staff seem friendly, I do not blame them for the state of the hotel. We paid a premium for this hotel, it‚Äôs not like it is a cheap motel. I have to stay here five

title: Good stay, Read this !
desc: I was very excited about staying here as it was my first time staying in Sentosa.  The hotel itself from the front entrance looks very nice but Infound when looking from the beach side it's starting to look a bit worn and showing signs of its age- it was the first resort in Singapore. Maybe a big paint and plaster update soon?. We didn't get off to a good start, Check in was a bit of a negative when we arrived after travelling for nearly 24hrs (and with a 3yrs old) the young Chinese girl told us our room was ready but we had to pay $150 to have access as it was only 7.30am - I did email the management a few days prior advising we had no option but to arrive at this time due to our flight and I knew if the hotel was busy we would have to wait - but to be told the room was ready

title: Shangri-La Shines Again!
desc: This is our 3rd stay at this amazing hotel resort and we love it more and more each time. The staff are friendly and helpful, often going above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay. It's because of them and their positive energy that we keep returning and of course the great rooms, amazing pool, excellent location and beautiful breakfasts help too. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel. It's one of my fave places on the planet. I wish we could have stayed longer and I hope we can return again very soon.

title: Good for young families with children rather than couples .
desc: I would very much recommend this hotel for young families as it seems to be very much geared up for young children . Huge choice of fast food for hungry demanding children who eat free in some restaurants . The hotel is very clean although a little tired in places and lacks a quiet adult only area other than your room which may or may not concern guests . If traveling without children I would advice taking breakfast in the executive lounge and eating in the Italian restaurant on the beach ,both of which are more relaxing than the other restaurants . This hotel is in a great location with safe bathing in the sea on the private beach area and also adjacent to the monorail .

title: good
desc: stayed here in March 19, didn't realise it was like a resort so lots of children, room was good size and bed comfy, breakfast we ate in the business place twice which was lovely and relaxing, 3rd morning we ate in the buffet and I could not stand more than 10 mins, food cold and children just running round all the time, round our table, knocking our table, the parents of these children said nothing and the volume of noise from children and parents was awful especially for a morning, the next morning the business breakfast place was shut so had no choice but the buffet but asked to be seated to the left which was much quieter and so much nicer. the pool is great, price of food and drinks are very expensive, we go taxi to the marina bay sands hotel and then went to super tree

title: Always a good stay
desc: The Family Fun package they are offering is worth the price. It comes with buffet breakfast and dinner buffet. The rooms are nice, with a sofa bed for the kids at night. The amenities are also very good. They have a kids club, water facilities, kids pool and slide. We always come back to this place just to unwind.

title: Clean Rooms
desc: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel is a little harder to get to than most, but once you discover that they have a shuttle bus that will take you back and forth to connect with the metro, you're all set. The room was clean, the view was spectacular, the staff was extremely helpful and polite. Down side- the buffet. There were 8,000 children (maybe not that many, but you certainly get the idea) and the buffet was overly noisy. Once we found the breakfast buffet on the other floor, we were able to start our day in a more relaxed manner. I highly suggest this. I liked the hotel and we'd probably stay here again.

title: Get away to Shangrila
desc: We normally travel to Kota Kinabalu at this time of year & stay at the Shangri la Rasa Ria there, but thought we would save a day of travel & just chill on Sentosa, since we were already in Singapore. I was warned by a colleague that the Shangri la was a little dated, and to be fair it is, but in the usual Shangri la style it was the staff who made our stay so special. Jeniffer who checked us in & made sure that we were comfortable was amazing, you really could not receive a warmer welcome. The meals were always good & in particular the buffets each night were exceptional, especially the local fare. The satay was great, some of the best I've had & it was so nice to watch the team cooking up a storm whilst we waited for our serves to be cooked. Without fault it was the wonderful

title: A memorable staycation
desc: Spent a birthday weekend there in March and was surprised at its service. When I dropped my bag at the concierge before I checked in, the staff there actually wished me advanced happy birthday upon knowing the next day was my bday. The hotel also prepared a small cake in the fridge for me in the room (though I thought it would be more appropriate if they put the cake on the table as I wouldn‚Äôt have known if I didn‚Äôt open the mini bar). My girls enjoyed themselves more than I do! There was a spectacular indoor playground, kids club, fun activities, water slides and even mermaid lessons! It was like a dream came true for them to be able to swim like a mermaid! As it was Earth Hour that weekend, the hotel also planned some night activities for the kids. Thank you for creating

title: Terrible waiting experience
desc: This stay can best be described as Waiting and Waiting. Incredibly long wait while checking in (over 45mins) and our room wasn't even ready. Check in time on my booking said 3pm and I only got my room at 530pm. It was important for me to be in my room by 5pm because that is the time my 2.5year old son has his dinner. I informed your check -in counter staff, but it sounded like there was nothing she could do which I don't blame her for. What I find issue with is, yours is not a walk-in hotel, if you understand that room bookings for a particular day are high, why weren't there preventative measures taken to ensure rooms are ready on time? Everyone I was in queue with at check-in was complaining! Not once did anyone come over to people in queue to explain what the issue was and

title: Staycation that exceeded our expectation
desc: It was over expectation. We didnt know that shangri la rasa provide such a wonderful kids friendly experience. The staff at kids club were professional in handling so many kids at one go. They even gathered the kids to brief on the Not-to-do things. There were also some adhoc kids activites outside restaurant after our breakfast on sunday. There was scheduled pool activites such as running across the foam mat at 1.2m pool. The pool staff were firm and alert in watching over the pool and slide area. The family package was comprehensive, we didnt want to go out of the resort as the activities within resorts already kept us busy. It was a pity that we dont have the time to go for the daily complimentary 1hr light sea activity and the unlimited entry of nestopia that looked so

title: Usual Shangri La high standard
desc: The staff were of the usual high standard in terms of politeness and efficiency with 1 or 2 exceptions. The room was very clean and well maintained by the room service team. It was disappointing the complimentary room bar was not stocked as it should have been on arrival. The dining experience at 8 Noodles was poor and separate communication both verbally and by email to Executive Chef and Asst Dining Director took place and they took on board the feedback. The food and service at Casseroles was excellent and well served by Helen and Reylee. The service from Audrey at Bubbles Bar was outstanding. I do think the hotel is a little tired and does not match the experiences we have encountered at Rasa Sayang in Penang in the past> This is a very family orientated resort and not ideal

title: Excellent family resort-hotel, and the only one on Sentosa Island with its own private beachfront.
desc: A very good Hotel, as you might expect from the Shangri-La Chain. Excellent choices and appopintment of rooms, with the ground floor rooms having direct access to the gardens and poolside area. Expansive, well-maintained grounds, with the added feature of a panoramic view over the new container port - for the Commercial Shipping fan this is a real plus! Amazingly warm pools all year round (and warm sea water too if you fancy a swim off the beach). Excellent catering options - even during the busier times of the year, everything runs smoothly with minimal delays. Outside the Resort, there are good, fast links to the City via the Cable Car system, the Sentosa Monorail (takes you direct to the Vivo Centre - a shopping paradise), or via courtesy shuttle bus from the Hotel to the

title: The kids just love it here!
desc: We booked a staycation at the Rasa Sentosa for the March school holidays. This was our second stay at the property and it was just as wonderful as the first time. In fact, it was better - because we learnt from our first stay and this time we booked a ground floor room with direct access to the pool, which was just fantastic! Having the resident peacocks stroll by our room was a bonus. Can't recommend this hotel enough for family vacations. The staff are super friendly (even with the hotel at full occupancy) and the facilities and activities perfect for the kids (and adults). The kids are already looking forward to their 3rd stay!

title: Fantastic resort for families
desc: The hotel is located on Sentosa island, so already you are very close to tons of activities and attractions. The public transport arrangements on the island are excellent although it was very busy. The hotel has its own bus service but is also very close (2 mins walk) to the cable care station or the bus stop for the Sentosa island bus service. The beach is clean and large, although due to the refinery and ship yard being near by I suspect not many people choose to swim in the sea as I didn‚Äôt see anyone swimming during our stay. The hotel staff are fantastic. All from housekeeping to the duty manager couldn‚Äôt be more helpful and friendly. Customer service was exceptional. Rooms are clean, and well maintained and housekeeping was very good. The hotel is slightly dated

title: Great location out of city
desc: Stayed on level 10 with ocean view. Room was very clean, reasonable size and had great views of the harbour. Resort pool is small and more than 3/4 is dedicated to kids which was disappointing. The resort is definitely orientated to families. No swim up pool bar and no drinks in the pool. All staff are incredibly friendly and very helpful except the lady Beth at the omelette bar in the morning breakfast buffet. I encountered her being rude to numerous guests (over 3 days) when they were requesting specific Ingriedients in their omelletes. The hotel is in a great location near the beach and cable carts.

title: extra costs charged to my card for using mobile check out and no refund after a week
desc: Hi Tane I wanted to follow up on a conversation that i had with one of Rasa Sentosa's duty manager (Vin) last week relating to a wrong charge on my card for my stay at room 155 from 16th to 18th Mar. I understand from Vin that the wrong charge was due to the utilization of the mobile checkout function within the golden circle app and the difference would be refunded to me. However i have not seen the credit after a week and i would like to follow up to understand the reason for the delay. I'm very disappointed with the fact that it is taking more than a week to process a simple refund and this is after email exchanges and calls with the hotel's team. Would appreciate if you can help to expedite the refund. Thanks

title: A Lovely and Relaxing Place to be in
desc: Stayed for one night after a seminar. The rooms was very comfortable and clean. The services was good. The balcony open to the sight of ship's anchorages which is a lovely sight. The breakfast and lunch spread was very good. I would recommend this hotel for anyone with children to come to enjoy the environment. One of the best that I have stay in.

title: Excellent Stay
desc: We stayed at the hotel for 14 nights. Everything about the stay was excellent. The room, breakfast, the pool, the staff and the beach...they're all so good. The courtesy bus to Vivo City is extremely useful running every 20 minutes. Taxis are called by the concierge and arrive within a couple of minutes. We tended to spend 2 to 3 hours in the morning by the pool and then out thereafter, apart from our all day visits to the Indonesian islands and Malaysia. Also some days we got back for an evening relaxation by the pool for an hour before going out again. The hotel does cater extremely well for children but it in no way spoilt our holiday like I have read from others. In fact it all contributed to the atmosphere and anyway there is an adult pool which is sectioned off...but it

title: Relaxing staycation
desc: I just came back from a one night staycation. Everything was good. I booked a twin room, which the hotel staff told me during the phone booking that they can help us combined into a single king size bed. But that was not done, which I think was the only flaw during this stay. Other than that, my family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids aged 4 and 6) had a relaxing stay. The bed after combined was big and comfortable, the size is sufficient for my family and I do not have to use the sofa bed. The resort has many nice pools for kids, the environment is beautiful, connected to Siloso Beach. The beach is very beautiful too. Service by the restaurant staffs, kids playground staffs etc was good, I have no complaints. Please keep it up! :)

title: Great staycation as always
desc: Stayed 4 nights under the Slice of fun package. Kids had an awesome time at the resort and everything was in right order. The only grouse we had was the shortage of parking spaces for hotel resident guests. Maybe hotel can allocate those parking spaces outside for those guests who came to attend dinners or functions and leave the spaces within carpark for hotel resident guests instead? As such event guests only park for the day whereas hotel residents will be overnight and it's a hassle to shift cars over the night. Other than this carpark issue, we are pretty much happy with the resort since we are long time guests of the resort since 2012! Much has improved and we look forward to our next visit in June!

title: Thumbs up for the team at Nestopia!
desc: Truly a family oriented resort for kids. The team At Nestopia were kind and attentive. They helped my kids to make their sliding and climbing experience a wonderful one! Providing hanky to help them slide better when we couldn‚Äôt really slide properly due to friction. Special thanks to taufiq who chaperoned my kids from Nestopia to trapizza to look for their parents(us) when they were too tired. Appreciate the attentive and care they show for young kids ;)) Keep it up!!

title: Great hotel especially for kids
desc: Stayed overnight with the family. Awesome hotel for kids. Very friendly staff, and great facilities. Well done. Will definitely stop over again and I highly recommend it. Stayed with 2 young kids and the water slides and the pools were the main even

title: SENTOSA'S No1 STAR - SHANGRI-LA RASA SENTOSA
desc: Such an awesome space with mirage like views! Plenty of full blown fun all around the island & retreat to Shanfri-la Rasa Sentosa's private oasis set by Tropical beach & ocean inlets, Exotic streams & Jungles canopies. An Amazing resort and island. Its very family friendly though with ample space for all guest types. I never felt encroached by the pack of excited illuminated variety of kids who really enjoy the spacious pool water world extravaganza. It's a really fun and lively poolside scene. If it really bothers you can take a short walk to the ocean lagoons which just go on forever there is plenty of suitable beach front lounge stations & a walk over to the western tip is an extensive water front garden beyond the adult side of the main pool the kids don‚Äôt stray over there

title: Haven for families who love pools and Sentosa
desc: We stayed for 5 nights after Easter. Were received at 10pm directly from the airport by helpful and friendly staff, and the kids were enthralled by their Tent in the room ! They just loved it. Loved the pool, water slides and the buffet meals. The rooms for adults were good, and the meal package was good value. Not the best food in Singapore, but a good selection of local and foreign fare. Perhaps my only criticism was that there was not a nice place to meet someone for a cup of coffee or tea. A friend came over and we had to have a tea and coffee in the lobby shop as the other facilities were being used for a conference. It was raining so the pool side bar was not a an option. The access to Sentosa's

title: Highly recommended
desc: This resort was recommended by a friend and did not disappoint! Our room was spacious, even with the double sofa bed for a 10 year old. Lots of space to put clothes in drawers, shelves and wardrobe. Bathroom was clean and supplied all the usual amenities. Shower was a bit tight to get into but I'd rather have that to compensate for the size of the room. Bottled water provided every day, we almost couldn't get through it all. Mini bar was complimentary and once empty you paid to restock... thought that was pretty good. Balcony was nice with a garden view. Be mindful if you are in a room on the curve that the walk to and from the room is not a quick one.... we were in 407. All staff were super helpful, from the reception, concierge, wait staff, housekeeping, tour desk and

title: Breakfast with the peacocks
desc: It was such an amazing experienced. Breakfast has a lot of choices. Child friendly facilities. Close to universal studio. Hop on sentosa shuttle bus for free around the island. Resort provides free shuttle to vivo city.

title: Great stay
desc: Went with friends for a weekend getaway and couldn‚Äôt have had a better time. Everyone was so helpful and pools were great. We enjoyed foot massages by the pool and even treated ourselves to packages at the spa. They had some great deals if we went at off peak times which was even better. Food was great with lots of options and room was comfortable. Is nice that their property is at one end of the island which gave us lots of opportunities to walk on the paths for exercise. Will go back again.

title: Family Friendly Hotel
desc: Stayed at the hotel for two nights from 5th to 7th April. Have not been back for thr past two year and I must say that this is a still a great property for families. When we arrived past 3pm, the room was not ready and Zoey was very apologetic about the delay. Minutes later, she managed to upgrade us to a one bedroomsuite which was very much appreciated since we were travelling with our 5yo son. The pool was great especially the kid‚Äôs section which has three slides and a small water park. There is also a newly built outdoor park for kids above the age of 5 which is called Nestopia and it is located next to Terraza Restaurant, by the beach area. The children‚Äôs play room is also good if one is looking to keep the little one occupied. Breakfast was busy but there are more

title: Mediocre family hotel
desc: Rasa Sentosa is a family hotel more than anything else. So if you plan to come here to have a romantic getaway or as a solo traveler it will most likely not fulfill your wishes. As a family hotel the Shangri La Rasa Sentosa qualifies in a few ways up front on paper: Baby/kids package, large buffet restaurant, big baby pool, kids club, beachfront. It does tick the boxes on paper and actually also in reality. Now let‚Äôs start with the good: - Extremely kids friendly what I have seen and heard from all sides: small things like the toilet signs are done nicely - The buffet restaurant stays well stocked and displayed even over a for ew hours - regardless of breakfast or dinner. - Food selection even with gluten free options, meat, fish, vegetables, desert, appetizers, salad, etc

title: Not even close to 4 star
desc: This hotel is no where near or remotely close to being 5 star and the reason l say this is as follows, 1. The room was very small and cramped and even more so when having to add a trundle bed for a child due to the fact the hotel do not have rooms with 2 double/queen beds, only 1 king in a room, or 2 king singles, we were stepping over one another to get in and out of bed, the decor and furniture was very dated vinyl slated floor not very clean or well maintained and the same in the en-suite. 2. The restaurant where breakfast was served was nothing short of a chaotic mess with a couple of hundred people bumping into one another, small children running around unsupervised, food on the floor, dirty napkins, unclean tables and the food was far from being 5 star it was very basic

title: Withholding one Star pending their compliant to Sentosa Island Management
desc: I really should be writing a five-star review of the Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa resort, however I'm withholding one because of the loud EDM concert that lasted until 3am. They staff did leave a letter in each room and when I questioned in person further explained Sentosa Island Management approved the permit. The concert stage at night directly abutted the resort property and was between Trapizza & the main grounds! I have a recording where you could hear the bass through the room and in the hallways. I love EDM, but not when I'm trying to relax & unwind with the precious little vacation time I get. After my family had a great stay at the Shangri-La Gulin 18 months ago, I decided my family should give the Shangri-La Sentosa a short. It was so enjoyable my son didn't want to leave.

title: Not usual Shangri-La standard
desc: The hotel is in a good spot with easy access to free transport and activities on Sentosa. But sadly it‚Äôs certainly not up to the regular Shangri La standard which I‚Äôve come to know in other locations around the world. It‚Äôs most certainly aimed at families which is great, but it definitely does not meet the ‚Äú5 star hotel‚Äù standard in my opinion. The rooms are tired and need renovating/updating which was my main disappointment. The bed needed a new mattress, the window between the bedroom and bathroom was broken, the general decor is old and needs updating and the rooms and simply just really tiny considering it‚Äôs a family orientated hotel and we were ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù on arrival. Other little things were irritating but certainly not something to ruin our stay. For example we had the

title: Simply enjoyable.
desc: Having stayed at several Shangri-La resorts we expected high standards. This hotel did not disappoint. Here are but a few of our experiences. Day one our daughter became ill and needed a doctor. The hotel staff assisted us to visit a local doctor in resort world. Thankfully our daughter received excellent local medical treatment and recovered quickly. The hotel staff subsequently sent a wee note and chocolates to our room for our daughter wishing her well. Day three the hotel staff called us in our room again to enquire as to how our daughter was progressing and offered her a complementary bite to eat. My daughter requested poached egg and toast which was delivered promptly. My daughters health and well being was certainly paramount by the hotel staff and was much appreciated.

title: Nice resort with good connection to the city
desc: The resort is very nice and well maintained. The standard rooms are ok, but the bathroom is quite small. The cleaning in the rooms was quite superficial and could be better. The breakfast is great, but very, very crowded. Lots of people and children, not really relaxing in the early morning. We were here for a longer stay and we also had the possibility to have breakfast in the business lounge. The buffet is 10 times smaller, but is very quiet and clean. The pool area and the beach are very nice. The staff is very kind and always looking to help. There was a shuttle to Vivocity every 20 minutes from early in the morning until 23h...this was a quick connection to the city since you have a metro station in the Harbourfront mall

title: Above my expectations once again
desc: If there is one place you want to stay in Sentosa, this is it. Especially if you came with your family. It has everything, children club, spa, pool, activities at the pool, private beach and more. I came here with my family for a 3 days stay starting on my birthday. I was here twice before but this time they surprised me by recognising I was a Golden Circle member. They even reminded me and assisted to merge my old account which was previously ‚Äúhacked‚Äù and I had wanted to ask them about it, talk about telepathy. A small cake was also sent to my room. Their buffet for breakfast and dinner were great, filled with Chinese, Japanese, Western, Indian themed food. The drinks during dinner are not just soda drink, they have juices, beer and wine free flow. What‚Äôs not to like. I

title: A perfect place to stay with family!
desc: We stayed here 4 nights with the entire family and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is just super with all attractions just a stones throw away in Sentosa. The resort is a paradise for kids with a superstar kids area inside and outside the hotel by the pool. The breakfast was lavish with a varied selection and they even had a separate kids counter. The only bit that we feel could be improved was on the special request made earlier. We were there to celebrate a grand occasion and had informed the hotel prior but nothing special was done by them to make them feel that way. All in all we had a very good stay -and would highly recommend this place for families.

title: Excellent Hotel
desc: I recently held a seminar in the hotel and everything was superb. From the bedrooms to the organisation of the event and attention to detail and the wonderfully relaxed BBQ dinner by the beach - it was all top notch. Joanne, Celine, Goben, Selvan and the rest of the team were constantly around to help us and cater for any of our guests needs. The food was also fabulous throughout the week.The resort is clean and cared for with gardens where herbs, fruits and other plants are grown and it's lovely to see the peacocks and lizards wandering around carefree. I would definitely come back to stay here on a personal basis.

title: Singapore's beachfront resort playground
desc: This is the only beachfront resort in Singapore and you look out towards the South China Sea. The kids loved sleeping in the in-room tents (don't ask, it surprised the hell out of me) and spent most of the day on the water slides - their preferred was definitely the giant tree-house slide. While they spent all day in the kids club ........ I took in all the dining options and even managed to do some work.

title: Perfect for Families
desc: We spent 3 nights here with our 11 month old. The pool area was great as there was a section she could crawl around in. The hotel was really family friendly with a great kids club, slides for the pool and even the buffet breakfast had an area for kids. The buffet breakfast had a huge selection of food and we really enjoyed the food. There was a day we got stuck next door at Siloso in bad weather the staff noticed us at the bottom of the driveway they came rushing down to us with umbrellas and covered us until we got inside and they gave us towels. The lady who was at the tourist desk was also very helpful with all the information to get around Sentosa. We really enjoyed our stay here as a family.

title: Well looked after, more for families
desc: We were 3 friends having a celebratory birthday trip to Singapore spending 3 nights downtown and 3 nights on Sentosa. When we checked in there was an issue with our booking as it was for 3 people and they said they didn‚Äôt know that and would have to charge us more. We contacted our travel agent for them to sort it out. We visited the W Hotel that night and decided to move there but when the Rasa Sentosa heard they approached us by the pool and asked if they could show us a new, bigger room and they would also waive the extra cost. The room was lovely and we decided to stay where we were. The hotel is on the beach right next to the zip line and other attractions as well as the cable car station Siloso Point. The grounds are lovely and the pool inviting. What I would say

title: Great location and good for kids!
desc: This is a very large resort with great amenities and particularly caters for families. Excellent pool area including kids water playground and water slides. Location is excellent, right on the beach. Lovely gardens, good food and happy hour was always welcome. The lady on the tour desk was so helpful and got us well organised on how to best use our time whilst we were there. Has a shuttle bus and the free Island bus stop and Siloso cable car station. Very happy with our stay.

title: Just relax! With kids...
desc: This place is amazing - soooo relaxing. Great beaky, all day pool or beachside, private balcony, service, and if... if you feel like leaving the resort, there is a free bus that takes you to the Vivo City mall. I have two kids and this family orientated resort tops it.

title: Absolutely loved it!
desc: We stayed at the Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa. It was actually fantastic, far exceeded my expectations, I highly recommend it. We will most certainly be back! Every type of cuisine and even a specially designed kids buffet. Also, something you don‚Äôt have included in a buffet breakfast normally..... real coffee! We also ate in the buffet for dinner one night and it was

title: Everything you need !
desc: Stayed 2 nights at the Deluxe Sea View room on Level 9 and it was awesome . Yes the hotel is slightly old , but it has everything u want from a 5 star hotel. The front desk lady Hallie was very friendly and attentive during check in . Breakfast were great and had many varieties of cuisine . It is a hotel catered to family with kids , but couples can still have a good quiet time as well. The location near the beach is convenient . All in all , it is a nice hotel and if you ever need anything , the concierge is just one call away.

title: outdated and aged family/event resort on the beach of Sentosa
desc: I have my serious problem to figure out what the vision of that property should be and who are they targeting with their offering. The hotel is a bit of a mess without a clear message to their customers. It tries to cater to all and nothing and performs at the end averagely for everyone I believe. title: Great for kids

We looked into moving hotels and when the management found out they really pulled out all the stops to make us happy with an upgrade and various other things. The pool is great and there are plenty of fun activities on offer to keep a young family busy. I didn‚Äôt really enjoy the quality of the breakfast as it was chaotic in its layout. However there is plenty of choice and they have special area for the children to be able to help themselves. Great poolside food and

The rooms are clean and quite large and very comfortable. But for us the big winner in this place isn't the fantastic staff, the perfect location, beautiful gardens or amazing food ! It was the way our 4 year old was looked after. On the days when we just sat by the pool and unwound the "Fun Team" had endless activities going on in and out of the pool for all the kids. From diving for treasure and volley ball to wearing mermaid tails and watching movies after dark poolside. The pool safety team were super friendly and great with all the kids but especially "big joe" and Xavier! If you have kids

The food he prepared just melted in your mouth, the selection he prepared was outstanding! Chilli Crab was to die for together with Spring Rolls unlike anything we have here. We look forward to getting over there again.

title: Wedding by the Sea
desc: We just had our wedding in this lovely resort over the weekend and it turned out way beyond our expectations. The venue set up was so beautiful! Our guests had such great comments for the food and service as well. Thank you so much to the wonderful team! We will definitely recommend the resort to our friends for their wedding.

title: Conference time
desc: Was here for two days for a brand conference the hotel is huge massive right on the beach great rooms very smooth check in clean good size rooms though the hotel looks old the stay was very good and comfortable but the only thing dint excite me was the food at the hotel the menu for both the days were identical same right from the breakfast to lunch very average food no great taste jus the spread was big would recommend those to going to this place can avoid the meals here.

title: Sentosa‚Äôs best family resort

The facility is well equipped for children of all ages , the fun team around the pool do a great job . The pool bar mixes good drinks and the cocktails are not over endowed with sweet cheap syrups like other hotels . Happy hour for 1/2 price drinks between 5-6 pm is a bonus . The buffet breakfast and dinner were exceptional with choice but more importantly , quality food is served . Service was what you expect at any shangri-la .. excellent . What is also great about this chain is their honesty and transparency.. what is in the hotel packages is what
