A few other hotels we visited during the trip were nice and tranquil and are much better for couples. Overall, an average experience and a surprising let-down for a Shangri-la hotel. desc: 1. Before the trip, I have sent emails to the hotel for some information. The hotel staff is able to response within the same day. There is a shuttle bus going to universal studio and other places and it is easy to get around the island. 6. desc: If anyone is looking at spending a relaxed holiday time in Singapore, there is just the best option. Staff (though not all) are courteous and try to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Hotel is located on the beach and also near the best of attractions like Luge ride, Mega Zip, Wings of Time show etc. Further the bus, tram and cable car station are just outside the hotel which makes it very convenient to travel within Sentosa and also if one wishes to go outside the island. HOWEVER a line of caution ----- In case you are opting for a package with dinner inclusive, hotel has limited vegetarian options. ALSO some of the staff at hotel are NOT VERY FRIENDLY which gives such a nice stay and hotel a bad experience. Otherwise everything including the pool, restaurant, kids

desc: We got the offer of Family Fun Package and it was anything but that. The Kids club was dark, dingy, dirty and small with no proper supervision and child engagement. We collected our Kids in tears and in distress. Now they suffer from kids Club-Phobia. They had weird opening and closing hours, as the kids club would actually close for 1 hour intervals through out the day for so called cleaning time. Kids club food was appalling and our kids complained of nausea from the food. The bathroom had a strong smell of Mould, the entire hotel is aged and in need of upgrade. My Verdict; Shangri-la sentose is a 2-3 Star hotel.

title: Relaxing and Enjoyable Staycation
desc: My sister rented a room for 2 adults and 2 children over the last weekend and we all truly enjoyed ourselves. Everything from the room cleanliness, the ambiance, the service staff and the hotel activities and facilities were just awesome! Restaurants - Dine on 3 - were good and my family enjoyed the seafood buffet on Saturday. On Sunday, we spent most of our time by the beach and the swimming pool - lots of activities to do and great times just fly passed quickly. My family had buffet dinner to wrap the day before turning in to rest and check out the next day. Other than taxi, you can take the free shuttle bus that brings you from hotel to Vivo City, and hence, travelling to the hotel is very convenient. Overall, i will highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a

title: Very kids friendly
desc: Went for a staycation with my one year old and I‚Äôm impressed with how kids friendly this resort is. The swimming pool catered for kids of all ages and there are several pools to avoid overcrowding. There‚Äôs also a nice kids room, as well as 2 playgrounds to keep the kids entertained. Breakfast was a good spread, huge variety with special attention paid to kids as well. Peacocks walking around added a fun element to breakfast. Room was a bit dated and sadly no bath tub available. The bed was nice and comfy and we all had a good night sleep. The baby cot provided was also very comfortable and my baby slept very well in it. Check-in service could be better as we were just given the room card with no further explanation on the floor or location or even where the lift

title: Not a 5* hotel
desc: Disappointing stay. We chose this hotel for our beach break as we have stayed in a Shangri-La before and it was amazing. This branch however was not. The quality of the hotel is not close to 5* and would be closer to a 3 and at a stretch a 4* hotel. If you‚Äôre a couple without children think again about staying here as this hotel caters to children and not adults -

desc: I stayed at Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort in July for one week with my wife, 9 year old son and 2 year old daughter. We had an amazing stay overall. The facilities are excellent and the staff very attentive. The incredible breakfasts were the highlight for us. The array of choices and quality of the food was superb. The whole family loved it. There was occasionally a short queue for a table in the morning, however, it wasn't too onerous. The only negative was that the outdoor breakfast seating area was not cleaned very well after the previous guests had vacated the table. For this reason we elected to eat inside on the other 6 days where the seating areas were cleaner. It should be noted that this hotel is very much catered for families, so if you would like a quiet

title: Great for kids, very helpful staff, rooms quite old
desc: The staff were very caring, amazing facilities for the kids, great pool, good location. However, the rooms are a bit dated and not what you normally expect from a Shangri-La in a business location. With a family tho, this is a great hotel as the kids have some much to do and are well taken care of.

title: Great place
desc: We spent 5 days in this resort and loved it. It is kids friendly and all the staff from the fun team are really amazing with children. They organised activities in the pool every day and kids really loved it. The rooms are clean and spacious, pool is great and staff in general very pleasant . We had a great time!!

title: Awesome!
desc: I read a few bad reviews on here so i wasn‚Äôt expecting too much. It was perfect. Great pool area, our 2 year old loved it, the fun team always have games going on for the kids. Never had a problem getting 2 sun beds side by side. Breakfast was amazing, probably the best I‚Äôve had. Huge selection and quality was great all week. We had the buffet one night and it was also excellent, expensive but excellent. Beers were expensive by the pool but happy hour is buy one get one free from 5-6. There‚Äôs is also a 7 Eleven next door, I bought some beers there and put them in the room fridge. We took the free bus to Vivocity a couple of times. Lots of restaurants there to choose from and also Timezone. It‚Äôs also about $14 taxi to Clarke Quay, heaps of restaurants bars etc there.

title: Excellent family place
desc: I stayed for 10 days. Everyone there won't let you need anything as everything is well prepared. The pool staff "FUN TEAM" are just amazing with thier intrestin activities. The hotel staff care about everything related to guests as me and my family were sick when we arrived & the guest relation manager sent to our room some lemon and honey just to make us feel better. Transportation is for free either you use the hotel shuttle or the public island bus. THANK YOU SHANGRI-LA for making my summer holiday an exciting memorable holiday. Tour desk are so helful and always greets the gusts with a wonderful smile.

title: Lovely Resort Vibe
desc: We arrived exhausted and had a piece of luggage missing from our flight so not in a very good mood. Initially we were staying one night but loved the vibe and the resort so extended our stay to three nights. The buffet breakfast is extensive, extremely busy As lots of people staying here. I found it interesting with the peacock hens running around and monitor lizards looking for a morning snack. The pool is lovely and the restaurants are good. The staff are all extremely welcoming and friendly. There is a bus that takes you for free to the shopping area off the island & the adventure parks. We enjoyed our stay here and recommend this resort particularly if you have children as they have a kids club with lots of activities and water slides. The rooms are comfortable clean and

title: A week at Rasa Shangri - La
desc: We spent a week vacation at Sentosa and stayed at Rasa Sentosa. while i found the hotel a bit too on the commercial side at the reception area and welcoming / departure - the hotel staff and team have been great during our stay! The pool is quite big but was too overcrowded.... the food is fabulous and the Chef was very attentive to our special requests. It is indeed a very children friendly resort.

title: Superb experience

So far, it has been a superb experience, reminded me of our stay in crimson resort in cebu, Philippines. They also have a station for babies, where you can get baby snacks, food and drinks. desc: The resort is situated along one of the few beaches in Sentosa. The beach is not good, but that isn't Shangrila's fault. I think the people staying are happy to have a beach at all. The resort, however, has everything a family could need. We stayed in the Panoramic Sea view room, and it was ok inside. The room itself wasn't that big but the balcony was very, very large. It had very good food. They also had a baby buffet too. There were very good baby food options. The mini ref in the room had reasonable space, which we needed for baby food and milk. desc: We stayed for 10 nights with a family of small kids, the hotel was entertaining all by itself and sometimes my kids didn‚Äôt want to leave And enjoy the kids club and pool. ‚Ä¢Pros Friendly staff Clean Amazing breakfast options like I have never seen ,they even have a baby food section ‚Ä¢Cons Room service food didn‚Äôt taste good Kids club needs updated options for older kids because most are out dated The beach is very muddy and the water has a lot of ships which makes the water murcky

desc: We stayed here for 1 week and found the Resort great. Food was very good in all eating areas, you just have to be prepared to paid top dollar. However with saying that we couldn‚Äôt complain with the standard of food. Breakfast Buffet was huge with lots of variety. The main highlight for us was the Pool, great size so there was never a problem finding sun lounges and plenty of space to swim around in the water. The staff around the pool were amazing. In particular 2 men who now their names escape me but were so so friendly. Also Richard and Xavier who helped with handing out the towels were so friendly and happy to see you each day. Overall we really enjoyed our stay here.

title: Super tropical resort minutes from the craziness of Singapore
desc: We were fortunate enough to have stayed here during our holidays and we would highly recommend this place to any family or couple looking for a very tropical hotel in a major city. We were blown away by how lush and tropical this hotel was, the view from our balcony was hard to believe that the craziness of Singapore was just minutes away. The pool and beach were perfect for our kids and they especially loved the kids club. We also all enjoyed the buffet breakfasts and buffet dinners which are on the very pricey side but worth it. This resort is a must do if you‚Äôre in Singapore but book well in advance because it‚Äôs so popular

title: Had a splendid stay!!
desc: This is a great beachfront family-friendly resort. Our kids had a great time with all the activities. If you can, book the all-inclusive family package as it is worth it with a fabulous buffet dinner! Thanks to the staff for providing a camp bed for the kids, which they absolutely loved. Would surely recommend for an amazing stay.

title: The Best
desc: This is our 5th visit to the Shangri-La Sentosa. This hotel should be on everyone‚Äôs bucket list of places to visit, exploring the world. Why do we keep coming back? The hotel is in a great location on Sentosa Island, no need for a combustion engine, just use the muscles that you were blessed with. There is so much to do here, you can pretty much lounge at there pristine pool in the morning and then have an adventure in the afternoon. The other reason for repeatedly coming back, is for the personable, friendly staff. These guys here make you feel like a celebrity and want for nothing! All the restaurants here are kid friendly and the choices of different cuisines is very appetite satisfying. Definitely a job well done to Nick Flynn and Sarah He, your team are unquestionably ahead

title: One of the best family hotels ever
desc: I'm still biased on my stay at Crimson Hotel Mactan in the Philippines but I gotta say, Rasa Sentosa is a close contender. We had a superb experience at the latter. So relaxing and they had an amazing service and entertainment for kids. We had our breakfast buffet and it was soooooo gooooooodd. title: Singapore trip

Open breakfast area is spoiled by birds, peacocks and lizards in the restaurant area and landing on tables for food. This cannot be correct and must be health and safety problem. For this spoiled our experience and we would not return to otherwise very nice hotel in great location

Great service from the pool bar, drinks and snacks brought to the sun beds. The beach right outside was again immaculate, cleaned daily and great for swimming. The hotel restaurants were

desc: The hotel own it's own beach. W, capella and others don't have. Suitable for family stay, it has baby club for free. Breakfast is good. But it is not as great as my last stay. Buffet dinner is with different styles from day to day. However, the price is expensive. If want to find a hotel in sentosa for family with a beach. This is the one.

The hotel certainly has some things that could do with updating, I don‚Äôt think this is a 5 star resort, but a 4 star

desc: Stood in line for 30 min to check in. Given complimentary drink while waiting for the next 1.5 hours....and then some at the point of writing. Hotel is probably not well- staffed to take the volume. Director of rooms sounds irritated that I am irritated. Pity about the Shangei La name.

That said, the room itself on the 7th floor was comfortable enough. The resort is super family friendly with a kids club, swimming pools and slides. The shuttle bus service that runs every 20 mins to the harbour front shopping centre is a nice touch and allows guests to get back into the centre of Singapore. Overall, satisfied with the 3 nights that we stayed here but the hotel does need some investment to bring it up to standard with its sister hotels in other countries.

title: Best spot for a family vacation
desc: Loved every moment of our 7 night stay. This hotel is perfect for families, with water slides, numerous pools, a raft of activities for the kids and a free kids club that is available for use. The staff are brilliant, they get to know the kids names and make the experience that more enjoyable. Buffet has a substantial spread and multiple food outlets in close proximity. The free shuttle bus to Vivo City and train was a good touch. We had one issue during our stay which was resolved well by the team. The one tip is be careful with water sports in the private lagoon, as their tends to be oil seeping in from the ships. Overall, an awesome experience and we will definitely be back soon.

title: Great Hotel for Families with Children
desc: Overall, we  enjoyed our stay. We were: Me + Wife + 3 year old + 2 helpers + 1 Mother in Law. Mother In Law required wheel chair access, and special help with food (needs to be blended). Reservations: Aiysah/Anisah were great. Patient and helpful with my questions, which were promptly answered and detailed in their emails. Before booking, we wanted to have a look at the  accessible room (for wheel chair). Korean lady (sorry cannot remember her name) at front desk brought us to the  room and explained everything in detail. Xavier at poolside (towels) was a breath of fresh air, very friendly and made me/kid feel very welcomed. Rebecca (8 Noodles - where we had dinner for 3 nights) was very helpful and courteous. She helped to arrange for the food to be blended. That

title: Good but not amazing
desc: 1 adult & 3 children stayed for 3 nights while transitioning from London to Auckland: Hotel looks and feels a bit tired. Perfectly comfortable but doesn‚Äôt compare to other 5* hotels we‚Äôve stayed at. Food is good but not the extra mile, eg juices for breakfast are not freshly squeezed, not as much fresh fruit as you‚Äôd normally get in 5* hotels. Nice setting for eating. A huge number of large container ships everywhere you look. Nobody seems to swim in the sea as I would imagine it‚Äôs not very clean with all those ships so close by. Only 1 shower for whole hotel to be used after checkout times - eg for an evening flight. A good hotel for very young children. We will look elsewhere next time.

title: Great relaxing resort
desc: We had a great stay at this resort, rooms were spacious for 3 people and great view over swimming pool. Staff are very helpful and accommodating. The restaurants are very good, food is plentiful and tasty. It‚Äôs a great location on Sentosa, as they have their own shuttle bus, which takes you to Vivo City for shopping and connections to bus & MRT. Highly recommended this resort.

title: Outstanding!
desc: We had a fantastic week at the Shangri-La on Sentosa. I visited with my wife and 2 year old daughter. The hotel is very big, but we never had any issues with overcrowding in the pool or at any of the restaurants so this wasnt an issue. Check-in was a little slow which spoilt our arrival a bit, however this was soon forgiven as we received a call from the Duty Manager near the end of our trip offering an apology and giving us a late check out, which was perfect as our flight wasnt until the evening, so we were very happy with this. All of the staff were very friendly, and our daughter loved the big pool, and the games that were put on every day by the "fun team" were excellent, even letting her join in (she was too young really, but she had fund walking across the inflatables

title: Great hospitality
desc: We stayed here for a week to celebrate my daughters 16th. The team went out of their way to surprise her with a gluten free birthday cake & surprise gift. Lovely hotel, great staff & the fact that you can do your laundry for free was an added bonus. The hotel is on the beach front & perfect for families. All the staff from the reception to the concierge & even the chefs really welcome you. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel but let down by food
desc: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 5yr old daughter - she loved it! We were in a pool view room. We were en route to NZ so main reason to stay was to relax as I have a serious illness and we weren‚Äôt sure how my daughter would be with the travel. I‚Äôd def stay there again. We did the half board option with airport transfers just to make things as easy as possible. Everything was great but we were disappointed by the food. I‚Äôd still stay there again but maybe on b&b basis and venture out for dinner if we had the energy.

title: A post cruise day room
desc: We stayed here as a post cruise day room, we arrived early but were immediately allocated a very nice room overlooking the pool. The room was very clean and we were provided free soft drinks and lots of water. We had a very good in room service, the satay was great. This is a hotel for families, there is a beach but just beyond is the largest number of commercial ships at anchor that I ever seen, so may be stick to the pool. There was a lot of noise from the corridor in our room and we thought the food and drinks were very expensive

title: Decent hotel
desc: I stayed here in Nov 19 and I expected more if I am honest from this chain , it‚Äôs a good hotel but very pricey compared to others in Singapore & on Sentosa. The rooms are spacious but average, the pool area is okay and there is a quiet bit. The pool bar food is pricey, limited and came cold every day. It is nice but not what I expected from the Shangri lah.

title: Staycation
desc: We stayed here with the kids. It was good but not fabulous for the money. Facilities are great though kids loved the slides the pool and they wandered in to the kids club. Service was flawless and I loved the offer of icecream to the kids when we checked in. Great Shangri-la service just not worth the money for one night and interconnecting rooms. Breakfast was very busy and the food was ok. Perhaps if we had booked earlier we might have gotten a better deal.

title: Great place
desc: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The room was spacious, a bit outdated but still acceptable. There was a cute monkey which kept visiting our balcony every morning. The hotel provides great facilities like the shuttle bus to Vivo city.

title: Best family orientated hotel on Sentosa Island
desc: I would rate Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa as the most family orientated property on the island. Excellent for toddlers, pre-schoolers to young adults. Resort has plenty of things to do for all the family. Sentosa island has numerous excellent hotels/properties but none which do such a good job catering not only for adults but for all age groups.

title: Superb stay and will come back!!!!!
desc: The stay was great and so amazing! We are here to celebrate anniversary and being upgraded to sea view room. The pool facilities is so fun!! Additionally, amenities for anniversary was superb! A very nice chocolate cake and letter prepared for us. At first, I thought there isn‚Äôt any but the surprise was sent to room later time! It is just an great experience! Everything is so good and especially their valuable staff yunji and kumar! Wish to see you guys soon!

title: Excellent
desc: This is a beautiful property, clean with modern amenities. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable with plenty of storage space. It is easy to get around in Sentosa island and a taxi ride to city center is 20 min. The breakfast buffet has an extensive variety of food items, all very good.

title: Absolutely heavenly - Best in sentosa
desc: After spending 4 nights at Sentosa World Hotels , this hotel was so much better then even our stay at Ocean suites !!! Terrific Buffett at night Terrific service overall Terrific vegeterian choices Chief Sous Chef Amresh Ramadass was excellent - best ever , Give our special complements to arrange unlimited Indian vegetarian food despite having a sea food Buffett that night . Excellent evening Children area is Outstanding , tiny toots area is great for children under 5 years Children swimming pool was excellent, We will plan to return for a week or longer again . Sneha Pillai was extraordinary to arrange everything for us and the mouse cake for our birthday celebration was delicious. Thanks for a lifetime memories

title: Another fantastic stay at this friendly and professional hotel
desc: Had another fantastic stay at Rasa hotel, food exceptional, staff very friendly and professional. Made to feel special and appreciated for using their hotel. Looking forward to returning next year as this is now the best hotel of choice myself and family.

title: Best staycation as usual!!
desc: Working in a hotel myself and I know it's not easy working in a family oriented resort, BUT Rasa Sentosa have blown my family and I with their services be it from Rooms/Front Desk/Restaurant/Recreation. I've been here a lots of times and I believe it's my duty to write a compliment when it's due. Rooms: We were located at Level 1 rooms. Both rooms are clean and consistent. Amenities are very good and kid friendly. We got an Aligator rubber mat in the tub/kodomos & kids toothbrush. Runner Vinesh and 1 Big dark skin but friendly looking runner named Mahen was funny n friendly. Arthur was very kind even though he knows little English, he understood what I wanted. Poolside: my kids loved running on e floating mat and we played water polo. Sorry did not get e orange tee fella

title: Singapore Staycation
desc: We stayed at Shangrila's Rasa Sentosa & Spa for 2 days and 1 night with my family for our year end staycation for 2019. I personally suggest booking through their online portal, as they offer more benefits with the price other booking portals are offering. In our case, we chose the Family Fun Package, one particular benefit that we love is the free dinner and breakfast buffet for 2 adults and 2 children. Second, is of course the different activities my daughter was able to enjoy. I am someone constantly looking for a place that offers great experience for my family and not just a place to sleep. If you are like me, this place is for you! Check-in was fast, the hotel gives you a classic resort atmosphere, food is delicious and offered different varieties that accommodates

title: An Experiment
desc: Have been meaning to stay on Sentosa instead of down town Singapore for years. I chose the Shangri La following positive experiences at their other properties. Nothing wrong with the hotel but not especially inspiring either. The pool area is spacious and the crew provide plenty of action for families with children. The beach is not especially nice but after all, it adjacent to a major port. The food at the hotel covers various styles of cooking and provides plenty of quality choices. They could make a bit more effort to make the bars actual destinations rather than just places for people who can't be bothered to go out. The staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful.

title: Wonderful stay
desc: Shangri-la sentosa did not disappoint. We had a wonderful stay. It‚Äôs a great place for a family vacation. Lots of activities for the little ones and a fantastic kids club. Friendly staff, good food and comfortable room (though not super spacious, but expected in Singapore.). The kids area at the pool was great fun and my kid went down those water slides for hours. Breakfast is a bit crowded around 9am, so go earlier or later. All in all, we will definitely come again.

title: Very good hotel but too expensive
desc: The Shangri La resort is a nice place to stay and its service is outstanding. Breakfast is one of the best I ever had! Rooms are OK, but not special. Taking into account the high price of more than 350USD per night expectations are higher than what the rooms actually are. Staff and service of the hotel are outstanding. The restaurant is very good but also too expensive. The price level is so high that this is not suitable as vacation destination.

title: great for kids but...
desc: if you have small kids its heaven for them.. great water park and pool (but never dream of swimming in it as an adult..) brakefast is extraordinary well presented and caters for all (again kids all over....) rooms are tiny (even prestige seaview rooms..) not much new after te recent renovation except some fresh paint marks... the concierge and the bell boys are most friendly, so are the girls at reception.

title: One of the best kid friendly hotels in Sentosa island with some need to further attention to detail
desc: Front desk staff were very welcoming and played a great role for the check-in, check-out experience. Opening of a Jade/Diamond lane was a great welcome which made things faster. Facilities at the hotel remains one of the best for young families with endless entertainment for the young ones. My kids enjoyed the pool slides, pool games with the fun team, indoor playground tremendously. Nestopia was an excellent place which was their favorite by far. Addition of a bouncy castle catered to younger kids who might not be very suitable for the tall slides. Only thing to note is the bouncy castle (If still there) will be the relatively short wall by the slide. My kid bounced up and fell out of the bouncy castle (~1.5m head down) as that part was not enclosed. Room cleanliness could

title: Best Breakfast
desc: We stayed in 3 resorts for this holiday and liked Shangri-La stay the best. The rooms are clean, service is friendly and efficient - as expected from Singapore and breakfast is the best with a vast varieties. I will go back to stay again :)

title: Bring your family here for staycation
desc: Lovely hotel. It‚Äôs kids Funtime at every turn. Hotel do have some dust and dirt. Overall still a satisfying experience. The pool is beautiful and kids friendly. Had a good time sitting under the tree staring into the blue sky. There‚Äôs even playground on the beach. You can play few games. Totally appreciate the kids stool for them to wash hands themselves. I got it in room without requesting for it. They even have kids sized hotel room slippers. 2 thumbs up!!!!

title: Great for Kids!
desc: The kids loved this place and still yearn to go back over a year later! The pool and kids‚Äô activities are amazing with kids‚Äô club and water slides etc. We opted for a Garden Room which opened out into the pool area which the kids loved. The only criticism was the second bed was a camp bed and the room smelled damp, albeit no mold was evident. The Indian food at the buffet for both breakfast and dinner was about the best I‚Äôd ever eaten. Stunning. All in all a top stay! We actually stayed in June 2019.

title: Relaxing pool beach holiday
desc: This is our second stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint. This hotel is very family friendly. Our young kids enjoyed the pool, water park, water slides, beach activities and kids club activities. The buffet meals arrangements given covid was well organised. We ordered what we wanted electronically and the food was delivered fairly promptly. The staff were helpful and friendly. Some of the advantages of staying at the hotel during this time are the lower numbers of guests and the limited number of people allowed in the pool and beach. We had more space in the pool, we were able to easily find available beach and pool chairs, and less waiting times in the restaurant. We will definitely be back!

title: Great Christmas Staycation at the Resort
desc: We had a great stay at the Shangri-La Rasa Resort, we arrived on Christmas Eve and had three relaxing nights. Check in was pretty smooth with the usual Covid requirements, we presented a golden circle membership on arrival and were given a great room on the top corner looking over the pools, Siloso beach and out to the sea. We felt very spoilt during our stay, receiving complimentary Christmas hampers and great service by all the staff. We had rebooked our beach and pool bookings and received our armbands on check in. We were on a family fun package which included buffet breakfast and dinner, all of these were ordered on the app, the kids got the hang of it too and the food delivery was quick and efficient. It was a great way to spend an unexpected Christmas in Singapore and we

title: Good experience during the COVID / peak period 2020
desc: The hotel was able to well control all the facilities usage for guests during this period. My family was able to use the beach and pool comfortablely with no over crowding situation. Well done Shangri-La.

title: Redefine a trip for my family
desc: Due to COVID, we have to change our oversea travel trip to local, and surprisingly, saving the trouble and expenses on flight with 3kids, checking in to Shangri-La Sentosa really serve us well. Easy access to beach, and pool facility that work best for kids within the resort. The toot club looks fantastic but we have no luck to get any slot. Hotel is also surrounded by all sort sight seeing spot around Sentosa, cable car station just next to it with a convenient shop 7-11, and shopping mall as well as theme park.

title: 5 stars to Chi The Spa
desc: This is my second visit to the property. Last time I went there for a short stay, enjoyed spa and some facilities. This time, I went to the property just to enjoy the Spa and lunch after that. I did Accupresure Massage (60 minutes) and my amazing therapist, Joyce, made my day!! It was an amazing massage. I feel so much refreshed and relaxed after the massage :) The ambience was great and the rest of the staff also nice. Definitely will come back again! Lunch was also amazing, loves the food and the service. Thank you so much everyone!

title: StayCation
desc: There are many new hotels on Sentosa Island but we keep coming here is because of the high quality service and cleanliness as well as the many activities we can do within the resort itself. As a family, we prefer a big room and we always love the garden terrace for the easy access to the ground floor where all the action is. The shuttle bus to and from Vivo was also great as we are able to quickly rush to get bathbombs and fried snacks back. The close distance to the cable car and shuttle bus to beach station is great for families who want to do activities outside the resort.

title: Ideal place for staycation
desc: Stayed at a pool view room with 3 adults and 1 kid. The room was nice and comfy although the sofa bed was a bit dated so there was a "squeeky" sound every time you move. The staff were very nice and accommodating, a real 5 star service. The breakfast was properly set up so that you won't have to get near other guests. We enjoyed our Christmas celebration at this hotel.

title: Best staycation
desc: Great facilities with private beach and pool. Nice breakfast varieties. Good place to stay in Sentosa for family with kids. Pool bar snacks especially fries and chicken wings were crispy and taste really best. Pool was so clean and less cholorinated soft water makes enjoyable to be in pool for long time.

title: Excellent stay with private beach
desc: Great hospitality and staff services, and packaged with sumptuous daily buffet breakfast & dinner. Spent most of the time at the private beach sun tanning and kayaking. We‚Äôd a great time without worrying overcrowding.

title: Choose nowhere but RasaSentosa
desc: Going to Rasa is like going to Bali... the kids loved the beach and the pool... and the staff made it more wonderful! Thumbs up to the resilient staff. Choose no other than RasaSentosa. They give you their best!

title: Christmas stay
desc: Exceptional service which has been up kept over the years I have been here. Dining experience is one I look forward most to. Food is also great. Will definitely be back again next year. No place I rather be travelling to in this covid period. Truly home away from home.

title: Great staycation experience
desc: Just some of the facilities looks a little bit old. Otherwise a wonderful experience. Nice staff, good location, pleasant scenery, quite a number of activities and yammy food. Very friendly to family with kids.

title: Stacation 2020
desc: Had a real exciting 2N3D stay from 23rd Dec to 25th Dec 2020. The rooms were clean and spacious with beautiful sea views. The staff was courteous and the breakfast buffet selection was plenty. I think due to the christmas season, everyday there was a surprise gift in our room - box of fruits, box of chocolates - which was a nice touch. The safety precautions for Covid19 were also in check. In all, a real pleasant stay. Thank you to the staff of Shangrila Rasa Sentosa for our wonderful staycation.

title: Family friendly staycation
desc: Family friendly hotel with lots of activities for children of different ages from beach activities to Toots Club, Art Zone and the poolside. A nice touch by the hotel was to include a fun beach park for the kids.

title: Great getaway from the city
desc: I recently had a short getaway of 3 Days and 2 Nights. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Would recommend rooms on higher floors for a better view of the sea. Breakfast was an ‚Äúala carte buffet‚Äù where you order using a e-menu on your phone by scanning your table‚Äôs QR code. Food was great with a variety of different local and continental dishes. Beach and poolside were not too crowded and reservations had to be made using online forms. It‚Äôs more suitable for a family holiday with kids.

title: Staycation
desc: The place is a bit old. The beach could be cleaner and the sand is seem to be less finer than Palawan Beach. The TV look like almost 10 years old with poor resolution and limited channels. The bed mattress is also not up to standard, it is not so comfortable.

title: Best resort experience
desc: To be honest i didnt have too high expectations but shangri-la exceed the expectations. They have wonderful service by their staffs, services are quick, even when serving breakfast. The pool is huge and beautiful. Huge pool for kids and has a safety barrier to separate from adult pool. He played safely as i swam around the adult pool. Love the private beach. Nice complimentary water sports! We wished we could enjoy them but since our child is below the minimum age and needed our care, we give it a miss. The booking system for all facilities prior to check in wins it all. Easy to book, even for last min. We will be back!

title: Front Desk Customer Experience needs improving
desc: Inflexible on granting late checkout to me simply because it was a group booking done by our events mgmt vendor. In the end i had to reach out to my sales contact of the shangrila group to get this done for my room. Same thing for my colleagues too, all flatly turned down by your front desk citing super lame excuse that hotel is running full house the next day...like seriously? in current environment where there are no influx of tourists and all and its not even school holidays period. Another friend who booked directly individually with the hotel for the same stay date managed to get her room extended till 1pm. I think the hotel can do better in this area. If you have to give a lame excuse, at least give one that is convincing. Some Breakfast items are so greasy, e.g.

title: Great great stuff x.
desc: The kitchen despite not being Halal was well adviced by the chef, room had kiblat, staff were amzing, facilities were awesome as a resort. Will recommend and come again. Maybe just an expresso machine for the room.

title: Fantastic
desc: It was overall a nice and fantastic stay especially with the activities that the hotel has provided. Due to covid, limited number of people is allowed to go to the swimming and beach activities and it is limited to the registered hotel guest which is understandable. The hotel and toilet needs improvement in cleanliness. Due to it being near the sea and old hotel, the room is a bit stuffy so we had to buy our own room diffuser. Bed sheet was slightly stained. Overall, it was still and excellent and fantastic stay

title: Good but not perfect
desc: Why it was not perfect? No bath tubs even though the bathroom is big enough. Not sure why. Art and craft zone not very good, the free watercolor were all mixed, the paid watercolor were dried up and staff refused return/refund saying it‚Äôs supposed to be dried and needs to add water but it was not that type, it was supposed to be wet because we‚Äôre selling the same item as well, we know! But still, we added water and nothing happened. Restricted time only 1 hour, not enough to paint finish. Total waste of money and time. Restaurant has dress code policy (no swimsuit). But this is a beach resort (?!?). We were hungry and were asked to get dressed first before dine in, but we still want to go to the pool afterwards. So at the end needed to shower, get dressed, eat breakfast then

title: Fun filled staycation
desc: Went on a 2 day 1 night stay at the Deluxe King Pool View Room. The check in was longer as we have requested for high floor. The view from the balcony view was serene and with birds chipping in the morning. Even heard the calling of hornbill. Shangri-la gave us complimentary float and sand play toys for our children. There was also a surprise delicious mini Chocolate birthday cake for my wife. Overall experiences were excellent. Good amenities like swimming pool and free sea sports activities like canoeing, paddle boarding and paddle boat. Luckily the weather was all sunny and we were able to enjoy most of the amenities. Will come again!

title: Good Hotel for Staycation
desc: good service and efficiency even with those safety measure control. room is ok but sometime too far to access facilities. (ask for a bigger room number which suppose to near the lift) a lot of activities and very suitable for family with children breakfast and dinner buffet is ok but better if more variety only thing I may disappoint is not able to extend the check out time. maybe the hotel is too full booking

title: Wonderful Staycation
desc: I have to admit, I was a little apprehensive about doing a staycation during covid but living and working in the same space had me crying out for a change of scenery. I chose the Sentosa hotel as I wanted to feel like I was away from SG and as a Golden Circle member it seemed crazy not to chose the Shangri-la. I'm so pleased to say it was a truly wonderful stay. From check-in to departure and everything in between was easy. Due to covid and the under occupancy, the hotel was busy but not crowed, so it had a great vibe (ie: it didn't feel like a ghost town or Picadilly Circus). The room was lovely with a great view and when the plug in the bath didn't work (it would close to retain the water) the hotel fixed it immediately. Arranging slots for the pool and beach were

title: Still great
desc: Having previously stayed at this hotel, I am pleasantly surprised that the maintenance of the hotel was still top notch and it was a great stay. Breakfast buffet was still awesome, even with the fact that we can no longer take our own food due to covid. Service was also great. Would definitely come back again.

title: great staycation
desc: great stay, good food and service, nice facilities. unfortunately it rained most of our stay so didn‚Äôt get to go out to the beach much but it was still a great experience. will definitely be back and hope the weather is better then!!

title: A Staycation to Remember
desc: The staff were very helpful, courteous and patient. Love the ambience of the hotel. The food is good and with wide variety to choose from. The best moment was strolling by the beach while taking lots of photos.

title: Best Staycation ever
desc: It was good experience to staycation at Shangri-la resort as we really felt like in other country and mostly disconnected with daily activity because of many activities and enjoying the beach directly connected to the resort.

title: Disappointing
desc: I would like to feedback abt the terrible experience at Shangri-La rasa Sentosa. We are staying here over the New Years weekend. Granted the Weather was rainy which was no fault of the hotel. but the service was nothing sort of disappointing. First, the reservation team gave us a lot of trouble with the booking. On arrival at the room, the bedsheets were stained. The next day we had to call the room service 3 times before someone came to clean the room after 3 pm. The room service was terrible‚Äî unfit for a 5 star hotel and not worth the price we paid. The food at silver shell cafe was too salty and inedible and they only gave canned food for infant even though we emailed them to ask nicely to see if they could prepare some simple pur√©ed food. The only saving grace was trapizza

title: Birthday Stayca
desc: love the outdoor view of the room and it‚Äôs damn good location. Had so much fun in Sentosa! The service in this hotel is beyond excellent! Will definitely come back again for stay! Easy to travel around too!

title: Value for money
desc: Very accommodating staffs, and very prompt response on all my queries via email. Good buffet breakfast and service was very fast. My friend and I enjoyed the beach and pool! Would book again and stay longer!

title: Bad experience, was locked out of toilet due to faulty lock
desc: The toilet lock was automatically engaged while I closed the toilet before I went to sleep. So, I have to walk out of my room 425 to use a loo on 2am in the middle of night. I couldn‚Äôt ask the staff to fit it as it might wake my two babies. Considering this a shangri-la hotel, I would never expect this to happen. I believe the hotel is overdue for a proper upgrade of the room furniture and lock. By the way, a drawer was also not working fine, my daughter nearly hurt her fingers while trying to pull a drawer out, we did feedback to the housekeeper, but she didn‚Äôt seem to be bothered. Maybe many guests have similar issues also.

title: Perfect staycation
desc: Check in was smooth thanks to Kimberly. Room ready for me and my children, clean and a nice kimono for my little one! We booked pool and beach before our arrival but could enjoy more time without any problem. Food was delicious and not overpriced. Breakfast buffet very good quality. Fun water sports for everyone. I also had a nice massage at the Chi and Jasmine was helpful and welcoming. My child enjoyed the kids club as well. Check out extended to 1pm so we could have lunch before leaving. In summary, a wonderful experience at ShangriLa Sentosa!!

title: Best Short Escape
desc: The breakfast was good. the customer service was excellent. personnel were very attentive to your needs. :) the room is big and the view was spectacular regardless of the time of day ( morning, later afternoon, evening, dawn etc. will surely go back.

title: Awesome birthday staycation!!
desc: Awesome stay! Everything is so perfect that we wish to come back real soon! We enjoyed our stay very much especially my daughter! She enjoyed all the hotel facilities. A BIG THANK YOU to every staff who made our stay a truly memorable one!

title: Awesome experience
desc: Awesome experience. Extremely helpful and kind staff, great facilities, very good food, and despite the hotel not being new anymore it is kept super well. We enjoyed our stay and even extended a night.

title: Great stay but can be better
desc: As a GC member, I believe there is a separate check-in counter for us however upon arrival we have been asked to join the same queue as non member. I have reconfirm with the lady in red tshirt which I suppose she is the SDA of the hotel, she told me that for member will also need to join the same queue. Only 2 counters were open for check in around 11.30am which slow down the process. During my turn, staff is efficient and explanation of the hotel facilities are clear. Feel slightly different as staff acknowledge me as GC member and my anniversaryüëè Upon arriving in the room, room was well decorated! Thank you Kimberly from Guest Relations and Housekeeping which assisted me with my request and I believe the decorations are done by housekeeping team. My girlfriend is really

title: If could put 0 I would, but the inroom dining wasn‚Äôt bad.
desc: Probably the worst hotel experience I‚Äôve had - really disappointing as we had read all the reviews online before booking. At the check in the staff forgot to give our credit card back and only noticed by the end of the day (we thought it was the hotel policy to keep the card). Almost every bar / restaurant within the hotel got our orders wrong or just missed parts of it entirely (multiple times). When enquiring about the missing orders were met with blank expressions... When booking the spa they said they were fully booked - then when I asked to speak to the manager - there was miraculously an available slot the next day. The room looked barely like the pictures online, there wasn‚Äôt anything in the mini bar either üòë Disappointed with the level of customer service as a

title: My Daughter's Wedding Reception at Rasa Sentosa
desc: Except for some coordination issues with the hotel's wedding coordinator (which was rather unfortunate and could have been easily resolved if the coordinator just pay a bit more attention and be more attentive). My family was overall very happy with the services provided by the hotel. The hotel GM was very helpful and their banquet manager and service staff were excellent! So all-in-all, my family had a good experience.

title: Best staycation ever
desc: Unable to travel due to Covid 19, we opted for a staycation instead for our annual vacation. We chose to stay at Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa as this is the only beachfront resort in Singapore. The moment we stepped into the hotel lobby, we felt like we were on holiday overseas. As is the norm now, safe distancing, temperature recording and wearing of mask were implemented as safety measures undertaken by the hotel. Check-in was a breeze. Prior to our arrival, we have made reservation for all the activities, like access to the swimming pool and the beach, as these were limited to 2 hours per day. We were given wristband which indicated our time slot for access to the beach and the swimming pool. We‚Äôve booked a deluxe sea view room. Our room is big, fully equipped with all the

title: Bad service and staffs are unemathetic. My daughter got badly injured in the sliding pool and their life guards didnt
desc: My little girl badly injured her eyes while swimming in the sliding pool. The staffs were not so great and the reason attributed was that life guard cant have their everywhere. It took an incident for hotel to act

title: Shangri-La's Rasa Sentosa Resort & Spa
desc: Herein detail my 1st day and night experience at Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa now. I have booked a total of 4 nights for my staycation....another 3 nights to go.... Check in: 22 Feb 21 check in. Was pretty smooth and check in was not a hassle. Given my room before 3pm around 2pm+. The lady, a Korean, speaks very fluent English and was very friendly and informative. She managed to get me a room on the 9th floor - to be quiet and away from the lift as i am a light sleeper. Kudos to her. She also helped arranged for my bags to be delivered to my room and it came just right after i reached my room. Sent by Joshua, he was polite and nice too. Facilities: Used the gym and private beach. Gym only can take 5 persons now. Actually found the gym a tad small for such a big resort.

title: Staycation
desc: The room is great. The covid precautions are well thought out and we feel safe and protected. We are normally covid cautious especially regarding food. The breakfast buffet is wonderfully done. Food is ordered by scanning the QR code. It arrives in small portions very promptly. The food is clean and of a very high standard in small portions that are just right, enough for slightly more than a taste but allows for some room to try various dishes. Thank you for a lovely staycation.

title: Lovely stay at family-friendly resort
desc: Made a direct Booking for 2 deluxe pool view rooms for the 6 of us (4 Adults and 2 children) under the Rasa Family Fun package. We reached the hotel around 3:20PM and there is a queue. Completed all the check-in formalities by around 4pm. We stayed on the 3rd floor Deluxe pool view rooms. Nice and spacious with sofa bed that can easily accommodate 2 kids. So ample space for a family of 4. No complimentary minibar. I did not manage to get a good timing for the beach and swimming pool. Only managed to get the earliest timing (8AM - 10AM) for the beach access and the last timing (7:45PM - 9:45PM) for the pool access. We enjoyed kayaking and playing sand at the beach. Ample lighting at the swimming pool in the evening. The kids did not get to experience the cool zone (Kids club)

title: Best Staycation for the family ever
desc: We have had 3 other staycations on Sentosa in the past 2 years. The two after the pandemic have been horrible.. Was really reluctant in booking another one but decided to go ahead for my girls' birthdays. One of the best decision ever. We worried facilities and rooms will be worn and old but all turn out fine. There are signs of wear and tear but in insignificant spots like the doors etc. Very well maintain overall. We worried meals will be bad because the previous ones took away buffets (which to us is one of the biggest joy of staycations) and the buffet we've been since pandemic was disappointing. We had our breakfasts and dinners during our stay here and we can't get enough of it. Most of the items actually tasted much better than our expectation. Restored my faith in

title: Staycation on a weekend !!! Good beach, pool, kids activities and breakfast !!
desc: Pretty impress that 6-7 counters were open for check in but check in alone took about 25mins or more for 2 rooms, hope it could be abit faster. Booking of facilities were simple with the wrist bands. Enjoy the beach and pool. But there was a particular pool safeguard who try to keep order in the pool but does come across rude with the guests. The lifeguard was the biggest size among the all other lifeguard. There was a shouting match between a guest and him and I find it very unnecessary and unpleasant. Also, it suddenly pour heavily and my sister who was carrying her baby request to borrow his big umbrella but was rejected. He said, sorry no spare umbrella. How hard is it to shelter a woman carrying a baby to somewhere there have shelter !! Think certain common sense and

title: Amazing family staycation at Shangri-la
desc: Just had an incredible wholesome staycation with Shangri-la Rasa Sentosa, which allowed us to fully rejuvenate by the beach! My family and I had a blast exploring all the complimentary beach side activities available - paddle boarding, kayaking, ping pong, we tried them all. We were also impressed by our cosy room that came with a beautiful pool view as well as the attentive friendly service shown throughout our stay from the smiling staff at the front office and housekeeping to Trapizza, Poolside and more! We especially wish to express our warmest gratitude to Joanne from Poolside who took care of us impeccably. She had a vibrant positive demeanour that instantly uplifted our spirits, and Joanne graciously ensured we had a great time by the pool, even going the extra mile to

title: Disappointed birthday staycation
desc: Slow check in and out with only 2 reception open when there is a queue forming. Wasn't inform to do health declaration earlier and guest start crowding up to try to scan small tiny qr code. Put in a little more effort to take note of guest special date will be appreciate. Overall kinda disappointed with a 5 star rated hotel.

title: Not a 5-star service
desc: For a 5-Star Hotel the service and quality of food/beverage together with the facilities wasn't as it should be for this hotel-class. Some examples: during check-in the room wasn't ready (not a big deal), but if the front-desk announce a phone call after 30 min it should come instead of asking what's going on after one hour from our end. Excuse: Sorry, we forgot you. Asking the staff in the gym for another towel to clean the treadmill after use (I mustn't do this), I didn't expect the answer: you'll get one at the front-desk! Please go there. In times of increased hygiene rules I expected some disinfection equipment (wipes, etc.) in the gym instead of a one small towel for personal use. Capuccino wasn't fresh but instant. Scrambled eggs in the morning were served cold and an

title: Spacious Room and Good Breakfast
desc: The room is spacious and clean. With slipper for children and a step stool in the toilet for children. Just our room view is block by tree. Friendly staff. Nice swimming and children pool. My son enjoy a lot. Beach facilities with kayak and pedal boat foc. Great breakfast with a lot variety and delicious.

title: Good place for kids!
desc: Very children friendly! Hotel team very hospitable as always. My 3rd or 4th time here definitely not the last. Breakfast service was very efficient. A little inconvenient when using facilities because of the covid restrictions but advance planning will address any potential disappointment.

title: Perfect Staycation
desc: Great staff, great hotel and one of the best staycation experiences we've had in Singapore. Love that they provided baby items like cot, bottle steriliser and high chair. Can't wait to come back in October for my son's birthday.

title: Fair stay, but overpriced
desc: I am not sure it is completely fair for me to review my stay. I don't normally stay at a big chain hotels as they lack charm and personal touch. I also don't imagine my perfect vacation on the place like Sentosa (with a lot of beach activities, people, etc...). I would rather be on a remote Pacific island. But, due to Covid-19 situation and traveling restrictions, over exhaustion and stress that piled up over the last year we didn't have other choice. So, these are main reasons for my lack of extremely likings and satisfaction. But, even than I do not think that overall state of the hotel justifies the price. The hotel is quit old, it is not polished or refined as one might expect. There is nothing splendid about it. Personnel was extremely polite, friendly, patient and

title: Enjoyable stay
desc: My family booked two connecting rooms Monday to Wednesday. It was surprisingly crowded at checking in which took about half hour. Think it is due to Easter break. Most of the guests were expatriates - I would say about 80 percent of them. I booked through Traveloka which found me pretty good deal with breakfast included, cheaper than the usual platforms . Got nice deluxe room facing sea. Room was ok. Reasonably clean. Free water and beverage provided. Was very impressed with breakfast buffet where you order from QR code and they serve within a minute or two. Breakfast spread was very generous with Indian, Japanese , singaporean and western selection. Good value. We had dinner at Trapizza. Service was good. Need to book ahead cos place is crowded. We booked the pool

title: Only come for the kids
desc: The hotel is old, not very clean and the food is very average. We were wondering how it can be a 5 stars hotel. Only come for the facilities for kids and the view. The lifeguards can be quite rude by the pool.

title: Family fun in Singapore
desc: Great value for a super time for the kids, enough activities to fill at least 3/4 days on the resort itself with excellent service. would recommend the garden rooms for a family with 2 kids, as otherwise think it would be a bit cramped.

title: Great family holiday location, perfect for a staycay by the beach.
desc: Great for kids, slides were a hit! Beach location is perfect. Rooms are good and spacious, and the kids had a tent to sleep in! Pool is large and good for younger and older kids. Dining is good, although only 1 restaurant in the hotel, so tended to eat at other places too. Great for a staycay in Singapore if you want the feel of a real holiday.

title: Staycay
desc: Beyond expectations. Yes the hotel is a bit dated but it‚Äôs well maintained. The rooms are not what I would call 5* but they are clean and well appointed with a killer aircon. The view from our deluxe room was top! Service /and food was 5*. The breakfast and Indian Food in room service was amongst the best I have eaten. Pool and beach with boats etc are great with kids and adults. It‚Äôs expensive but worth it!

title: Shangri-La Sentosa with Family (two young kids)
desc: Excellent experience. Probably the best staycation you can get in Singapore if you miss travelling: there's the beach, nice pool and plenty of activities for kids. Perfect for a family trip. Not sure it is the best for couples but for a families, it is a no-brainer. They will enjoy and therefore so will you. Just a bit sad that because of covid there are restrictions (2h at the pool/day) but it's the same everywhere anyways. We took the family package: excellent thing to do: hydrodash is a lot of fun (but be careful though: you need to take a cab for this: it is not close unless you feel like like walking for 20 minutes minimum).

title: More than five stars!
desc: An interesting trip smacked in between local restriction inhibiting in-dining and then relaxed rules for dining-for-two. Despite what would appeared to dampen a trip for our family of five, this turned out pretty well. We stayed here in March and now in June as the kids really like it (and have also booked for year end Dec). This time round, we did more stuff like beach swim, kayak / SUP and other local activities like Mega-Zip. While Rasa is tucked away at a corner of the island, it‚Äôs superbly connected via shuttle (beach / road) which takes you to the beaches and attractions while you can take an easy stroll from Siloso to Tanjong Beach (~3km). Despite the usual comments about the hotel looking old, it‚Äôs only superficial. Actually old is gold! The staff are very attentive and

title: A delightful ‚Äúoverseas‚Äù staycation
desc: Enjoyable staycation in an Island Suite despite the no dining-in restriction. Outstanding service by all levels of staff and the thoughtful gestures to mark my daughter‚Äôs birthday made it a memorable experience. We loved the soft sandy beach and kayaking in the sea. Excellent family hotel/resort for those looking for an ‚Äúoverseas‚Äù getaway until we can travel freely again.

title: Great family resort
desc: Great facilities but room and hotel is a bit dated. However the available facilities e.g. the pool and beach access with water activities were wonderful. Would certainly stay there again especially given the lack of traveling that we can go for currently.

title: Staycation during the pandemic
desc: The only beachfront resort in Singapore with free use of beach sports activities. Pool is warm and nice and the kids pool and slides are awesome for the kids. Only issue was the room did not have a bidet spray for better hygiene. So please install one in all the rooms. Overall experience was fantastic.

title: Good experience although is old hotel
desc: Overall experience was good. The room service pretty fast and they also reach out in advance prior arrival to see if I need any further help Area for improvements 1. Check in process need to be faster 2. Beach need to be clean up 3. Maybe need to renovate the room

title: Fab 5D getaway for the family
desc: Despite the inconveniences of Phase 2 HA - having to eat all meals in the room/balcony and having to book 2-hr beach and swim slots ahead of time - our family had a great time. The pool, water slides and beach were enough to keep the kids entertained for 5 days, without having to venture to the kids club or arts and crafts area. Staff were lovely, rooms were clean, and they even set up a tent for the little ones to sleep in. Highly recommend (especially since traveling isn't on the cards yet)!

title: Great staycay despite the Phase 2 HA
desc: Had good fun at the resort. It is clean, fun with beach activities and love the room. Thank you to accomodating our request for a room with bathtub. The beachfront view is awesome. Tho we had to dine in and order delivery, it was still an enjoyable stay. Do note that if you are ordering grab food delivery, do it before 5pm. It is hard to get a driver and it can be hours before u get a response that no driver is available. Alternative is to take the free shuttle bus out of the resort to takeaway food from Vivo.

title: Excellent right from booking to checking out.
desc: Be it online or physically, their services are excellent and seamless. All staffs are friendly and always wanting to help out. Activities available are awesome for the whole family. My 8 yr old daughter really enjoyed herself during the stay!

title: Not worth the money spent, doesn‚Äôt feel like 5-star hotel at all
desc: I have heard good reviews about hotel, especially for family with children. I traveled with my kids and found having kids pool and indoor playgrounds very nice. The location is good as well. Given hard time now for everyone I kept my eyes closed for wrongly brought items for breakfast or very slow service, as well as last minute cancellation of spa appointment. However, was very disappointed how hotel handled payment for in-room dining. As dining-in was still not possible during our stay, QR code was provided for ordering food. I was trying to request for payment for all our in-room dining at a check-out but apparently it was not possible and we switch to pay as we go. So next time they would bring in food and then when you just started eating come for payment, which was

title: What a family friendly hotel
desc: We really had an enjoyed stay in the hotel. My daughter accidentally hit my chin and caused her nose bleeding when she played the water slide and the experienced safe guards performed first aid to her and the medical team attended to us in 5 mins! What a professional well trained team, big thank you to them. In addition, the art and craft class as well as the indoor playground all the staffs are friendly and my daughter can't wait to go back againüòÄ

title: Love the view and impeccable service
desc: We chose to use our last SRV on Shangri-La, mainly for the sea view and it did not disappoint. Of course this isn't the Caribbean so it was full of tankers and ships occasionally blowing their horn but I found a certain charm in that. Particularly being able to work while gazing at the sea was very nice. We made all sorts of requests which the front desk met very well (and they even somehow guessed that I did not want a tub, and waived the extra charge to switch). A few things to note is that it is quite far from most things so getting around is difficult unless you drive. The shuttle to Harbourfront is useful but starts late at 11am. The Sentosa buses start earlier but the walk up the sloped driveway to the hotel can be difficult if you have elderly or prams in tow. Also note

title: Excellent service throughout our stay!
desc: We booked a Deluxe King Seaview room for 2 nights. My family of 5 (2 old folks and 5 year old) totally enjoyed ourselves and wished we could spend a few more days there! Really love the consistent service we received throughout our stay, be it at the reception, the restaurant or at the facilities such as the pool, beach and toots club. Very kids friendly hotel with water play and slides at the pool. We also brought him to the private beach for kayaking. My son was pleasantly surprised with the dinner buffet menu as they served cotton candy and gummies! Breakfast was amazing. Even when the restaurant is packed, food was served really quickly, variety and quality was good.

title: 5-star rating staycation!
desc: We really had a great time at Shangri-la Rasa Sentosa. Service is 5-star. Location wise, enough dose of vitamin sea. We did a lot of beach activities, kayak, stand-up paddle board, pedal boat. With attractions and restaurants on Sentosa, location is very strategic. Room - with the balcony in each room, it's a wow! Spa- Service and ambience were relaxing. Food - is yummy, serving is more than enough, service is fast and price is reasonable. Overall, we had an awesome experience. Thank you for making our stay splendid!

title: Awesome staycation
desc: Stayed 4 nights as part of a staycation and had an awesome experience. Great beachside hotel if you‚Äôre stuck in Singapore. We had a great time despite unreliable weather. From the kids club to other activities, we had plenty of choices. Awesome location with easy access to the beach and other beachside clubs.

title: Rainy staycay but enough things to do in the Resort
desc: Shame it rained so much during our stay. Could use pool only once. limited slots for the mini toots, pool etc in morning period. but luckily we managed to get 1 slot. Great service, good food, courteous staff.

title: The Perfect Landmark Birthday Celebration Getaway!
desc: Shangrila Rasa Sentosa is a beautiful and vast property landscaped with greenery and surrounded by the sea. It's like a retreat in a safe haven on a private island with the beach all to yourself and the pristine blue ocean a sight to behold. The rooms are spotless and spacious and the hotel staff go out of their way to ensure they delight you with Birthday greetings and balloons arranged on the bed when you arrive, the complimentary cake hidden away in the mini-fridge and the lit cake brought to the table while dining at the Silver Shells cafe. The chef also made sure to specially cater to my husband's food preferences and customised the salad for us. The buffet menu is huge and all brought to your table during these times of safety precautions. The pool attendants were also

title: Amazing!
desc: One of the best hotels in SG! I had a wedding here. The food is great, service is outstanding and the ambiance is like a resort. The building is a bit old but well maintained. It seems crowded with families during my stay. I would love to stay here again!

title: A weekend staycation
desc: Shangrila Rasa Sentosa is strategically located for its one stop shop of several fun activities, from the cable car right at the door step of the hotel to the outdoor hiking of Fort Siloso as well as the sun, sand and beach play. The staffs were accomodating and did their best to make us feel comfortable, especially for my husband's and daughter's birthday. The hotel's complimentary chocolate cake slices were deliciously yummy. The seaview room was fantastic. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back in the future as we enjoyed the private beach and the water sports activities.

title: A fantastic beachside staycation
desc: Life away from the city with a touch of the resort staff's friendly service. Reminded me of Santorini. The whole of Sentosa for activities and had a great start to end experience. #Stargazing, #islandexploring,

title: Much needed break staycay
desc: Definitely a come back to this beautiful hotel! Great service when i am checking in with the guest reception staff name Nurul,she explained to me all the check-in details and procedures provide me with the much info i needed and plus late check out and a beautiful seaview and pool view room! Breakfast was send to our room,spacious and clean! Thank you Shangri-la for the great stay and service!

title: Staycation with family
desc: Overall experience was wonderful. However booking the facilities was a little restricted due to the limited slots and booking slots get taken up fast. I was not aware that I could pre booked the hotel facilities 5 days in advance and by the time it is made known to me, most of the slots are already taken up. Improvement that you can be considered is to send a reminder via phone/mobile instead of email (cause it may go to junk) to inform guest regarding pre-booking the facilities in advance.

title: Disappointing Hotel
desc: Nice view with relatively private terrace. Room was not new but well kept and clean. The usual amenities were provided although of budget hotel quality. A box of fruit was complimentary, a nice touch at a glance, but one of the apples was nearly rotten. The buffet breakfast was mediocre and not to the standard one would expect. Poolside drinks are available but was served a mocktail made with rancid coconut. Equipment for water sports was included with beach access but the life vests were tattered, the paddle board missing the safety ankle strap, the board surface was worn down and in need of replacement. The Shangri-la Rasa is a resort hotel with it‚Äôs best days behind it. Time for them to up their game or lower their room prices.

title: Slow service and failed to deliver what's promised.
desc: The stay was to celebrate my wife's birthday, had correspondence with hotels that birthday amenities will be prepared. But hotel failed to deliver, nothing was prepared and absolutely no follow-up for failing to fulfill my request which was agreed be hotel via E-mail. Took 1 hour of standing to be served for check-in, slow response to make the long wait in the line bear-able when a packet drink was only offered after 30 mins of waiting/standing in the line. Bottom line, hotel failed to deliver their end on my request, and service was bad.

title: Great Hotel for families!
desc: I booked this hotel to celebrate my birthday with my kids. This hotel is perfect for families with kids. I booked a basic room with the king bed. It was actually spacious than I expected. The room was clean and smells like fresh linens when we arrive. Food service was quick too which i like. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. Thanks again for an amazing service. We‚Äôll deinitely be back!:)

title: A 3 star hotel with 5 star price.
desc: It took 1.5 hrs to check-in. Got to my room at around 4:40 pm. Overall I felt the facility was pretty average. The quality of breakfast was pretty bad. The only thing I liked would be the in-room dining food. But on a whole, it was a disappointing experience.

title: None
desc: Stayed with SLRS on 29/09/2021. I was able to check in early as rooms were available at 10 am, checking in process with fast. The receptionist told me, the room was at the end of the last 3 units of the walkway. But rest assured, the view is nice (I changed from sea view to swimming pool view due to request of additional bed). When I enquired about the breakfast buffet for an unvaccinated person (On the rules and regulations), the reception personnel told me regarding this issues, I have to check with the Restaurant. So I went from Level 5 (Lobby Area), traveled down to (Level 3, Restaurant). From speaking to 1st person and then 2nd person (As the restaurant crew has no idea about the rules and regulations) I had to get the manager to speak to me. She told me that, an

title: Good for Children
desc: This is likely one of the most children/family-friendly places for a staycation in Singapore. There are plenty of facilities and activities to keep children busy pretty much the entire day. Our children got to expend all their energy, and thoroughly enjoyed it all. The room was comfortable, albeit a tad tight in space for a family of four. It felt the same in the shower too, and I kept bumping against the panels even though I am only slightly more than six feet tall. The rest of the room however was good - comfortable, reasonably well-equipped, clean, and the balcony had a great view of the beach (a rarity in Singapore I guess). Breakfast was good - among the better ones in terms of food quality and variety when compared against most of the other hotels we have stayed in

title: Worth more than 5 stars rating. Attentive and friend staff thru out the whole hotel
desc: This was a family trip to rasa dentisa shangri-la for 3 days 2 nights after staying at the city's shangri-la for a few times this year. Checkin at 2pm was crowded and took about 25 mins to reach my turn. But the check in staff "zulk" was fantastic. He was very detailed and was eager to help with my bookings of room as well as bookings of the various facilities. He was also very willing to help to find a room that could allow us to have a late check out at 1pm. On the first day the cool zone club was undergoing some work hence moved to netopia. It's very hot so we left after 10 mins. Went to the pool and had a good time. Life guards were very friendly and entertained the kids. You are able to order food and drinks to enjoy at the pool side too. Although beware of the

title: Magnificent Staycation
desc: The staff: Staffs are nice, customer oriented, friendly indeed, all smiley and welcoming!! Even the staff at their pool and beach! Service: Excellent!! Fast and easy check in process. Through scanning a QR quote, I was able to use it to book breakfast slots, facility and services in the hotel. Room: Spacious room with sofa bed that can accommodate for a family of 4. Bathroom might need a bit of maintenance. The sad part was our deluxe pool view was blocked by a huge rainforest tree. Pool & Beach: Definitely a family oriented hotel!! They do have slides, a playground area, some other kids play area, private beach and the water sports activities. Food: The buffet breakfast is excellent. Unfortunately, buffet dinner has limited choices and the food is mediocre. Overall,

title: Good family hotel
desc: This hotel has its own private beach which is fantastic as the kids love to swim very much! Everyone was very friendly. Had a wonderful time here. We normally stay at Shangri-La Orange Grove but this might be our future holiday favorite.

title: Great place to relax!
desc: The room is big and cozy. I have stayed in Rasa Sentosa for at least 10 times, our family loves the stay so much and keep coming back every year. This is like our 2nd home. Over the years, we see the improvements by the Shangri-La, making great effort to make our stay experience a great one each time we visit. Thank you and Well Done!

title: Did not feel welcome at all
desc: The arrival experience was not up to expectation. I presume the hotel brand themselves as luxury and upscale branding but I did not feel welcome during the check-in. The staff looks un-interested during the check-in and i can only recall I was told "your room does not have a bath tub" which I did not even ask for it. As much as i understand that your team sets the expectation right for guest, I think there could be a better way to put it across and does not give the feeling of unwelcome. I guess that was the start of poor expectation and things did not get better. Overall we did not feel welcome at the resort and the check out was not any better. We were chased to go out to insist us drop on express checkout when i wanted to que and give some feedback. I guess feedback was not

title: Family fun
desc: It‚Äôs always a very good experience staying in Shangri-La Rasa. The amenities inside the hotel will make you want to stay and not go around anymore. The kids particularly love the pool where they have a dedicated water play area and water slides. The buffet is also highly recommended both for breakfast and dinner.

title: Excellent Christmas Staycation and All Around Amazing Service
desc: Loved the entire vibe of the hotel. The view and the pool was amazing. The sunset was absolutely beautiful. Choose the higher floors though or else you will end up blocked by the garden trees (we booked two rooms and the second one was on the lower floor and the view was just trees). Amazing service from the staff. The rooms does feel a bit dated but the overall environment and views more than make up for it.

title: Great visit to Sentosa
desc: Took the alcohol with dining credits package. My trip was awesome. Dining credits can be used in silver shell, beach bar and room service. The beach bar can only be accessed with the pool or beach access bookings. Need to book to use the various facilities. (A good safe distancing measures that helps crowd control) Only thing is that i was not interested to visit other parts of Sentosa.

title: ShangriLa Rasa Family Fun Package
desc: The check in and check out was fast using the shangrila app. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Special shout out to the staff at cool kids club, Sri and Nell. We really like the food at the buffet breakfast and dinner. We had to check out but my boy was still sleeping so i had to carry him. the person who assisted us with our luggage during the check out was awesome. Very considerate not to make noise. ( Not sure of his name but started with "J" and Was assigned jan 28 @ 2pm). The welcome pack for kids was cool, my only suggestion is to include bath soap and shampoo for toddlers (like in ShangriLa Orchard)

title: Nice Staycation
desc: Stayed at Shangri-La Rasa Sentosa with my family for my son's birthday, we booked 2 rooms. Check is process was easy. The facilities are great, huge swimming pool and beach access. My kids spent almost the whole time swimming and playing on the beach. The staff are nice and friendly especially to children, a small cake was prepared as I requested. There is also a kids club with indoor playground and some craft activities. Hotel room is old design but pretty functional. Breakfast the next morning was great too. Nice variety compared to other hotels we have been for staycation. We had a good time and probably will return to stay again. Only issue was our bed made this creaking sound whenever we got on and off the bed so it kind of disturb my children's sleep. We are normal sized

title: Nice ambiance with great views!
desc: Generally. although the hotel a bit old (tho refurbished) but generally clean and tidy. Staff were also very friendly and nice. Good view of the pool and the beach.
